loans.name: Benkadi Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI IV sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelle à N’TESSONI, l’un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (Sikasso). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et le prêt passé a été bien remboursé.
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autre  l’arachide, le mais et le pois sucré.
Avec  DITIO beau milieu de la photo position assise,avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des engrais  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 65.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "BENKADI IV" are married women, who average 32 years of age and three children each, all living in traditional families in N’TESSONI, a village in the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali (Sikasso). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their second farm loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crops grown include peanuts, corn, and sweet peas, as is the case with DITIO, who is sitting right in the middle of her row in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase fertilizer to maintain 0.5 hectare. After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women in the village and at the market.

She plans on making a profit of 65,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, such as fertilizer

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
Las 14 integrantes de este comité son mujeres muy trabajadoras que están saliendo adelante, están luchando por sus familias ya que quieren darles el futuro que ellas no pudieron tener.
Una persona digna de destacar es la Sra. Leida, quien se dedica a la venta de bebidas en general, comenta que con su negocio mantiene a su familia, ya que es su principal sustento. Está creciendo gracias al sacrificio que está haciendo. Comenta también que los fines de semana es cuando más ventas tiene, y es por eso que está pidiendo de crédito, para poder invertirlo en la compra de vinos, gaseosas, cervezas y demás bebidas. Agradece por esta oportunidad que ella y sus amigas están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The 14 members of this committee are very hardworking women who are moving ahead striving for their families because they want to provide them with the future they themselves were unable to have.

One person worthy of note is Leida who sells beverages in general.  She comments that she supports her family with her business since it’s her main source of support.  She’s growing thanks to the sacrifice she’s making.  

She also comments that her best sales are on weekends and this is why she’s asking for the loan to be able to use it to buy wine, soft-drinks, beer and other beverages.  She’s grateful for this opportunity she and her friends are receiving.

loans.use: to buy beverages.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Virgen del Carmen 2  está en su 7mo ciclo, 3 de estas mujeres están con ingresos muy bajos según la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza que las integrantes han hecho. Son mujeres con mucho entusiasmo y quieren salir adelante por medio de su trabajo.
Erodita, una de las integrantes, se dedica a la costura, y con su trabajo está ayudando a su familia. Ella hizo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, lo que mostró que ella se encuentra con ingresos muy escasos, pero es por ello que Erodita se está esforzando mas para ir creciendo. Ella solicita de este crédito para poder seguir con su costura, y poder comprar telas e hilos. Todas las integrantes están agradecidas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo, pues les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group called Virgen del Carmen 2 is in its seventh cycle. Three of these women have very low incomes according to the poverty elimination survey that the members have taken. They are women with a lot of enthusiasm and they want to move ahead through their work.

Erodita, one of the members, is a dressmaker, and with her work she is helping her family. She took the poverty elimination survey, which showed that she has very little income, but that is why Erodita is making an effort to grow. She is asking for this loan in order to be able to continue with her dressmaking and to be able to buy cloth and thread. All of the members are grateful for the opportunity they are receiving, since it will be of great help to them.

loans.use: to buy cloth and thread

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelle à N’TESSONI, l’un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (Sikasso). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et le prêt passé a été bien remboursé.
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autre: l’arachide, le mais et le pois sucré.
Avec  MAH 1ère personne à gauche de la photo position assise,avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des engrais  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 95.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "BENKADI II" are married women, who average 47 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional families in N’TESSONI, a village in the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali (Sikasso). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their second farm loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crops grown include peanuts, corn, and sweet peas, as is the case with MAH, who is standing first from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase fertilizer to maintain 0.5 hectare. After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women in the village and at the market.

She plans on making a profit of 95,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, such as fertilizer

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Guapa está en su Primer ciclo  del programa de comité, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 de las integrantes están con ingresos muy bajos, tratando de mejorar por medio de su trabajo.
Mariela es una de las integrantes, quien por medio de la venta de helados tiene los ingresos para ayudar a su familia. Es una persona muy emprendedora, que con su esfuerzo y su sacrificio ha venido creciendo. Hoy ella pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de helados, con lo que podrá seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y mejorando su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Guapa” group is in its first cycle in the committee program and are taking the poverty elimination survey; three of the members are very low income and trying to improve by means of their work.

Mariela is one of the members who by means of selling frozen treats earns income to help her family.  She’s a very enterprising person who with effort and sacrifice has been growing.  Today, she’s requesting this loan to buy frozen treats to continue investing in her business and improving her undertaking.

loans.use: to buy frozen treats to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is married with 3 children. Aida  is 59 years old and lives in Segatic Diot, Clarin, Philippines.

Aida sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, soaps, etc.

Aida has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.  In the future, Aida hopes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is widowed with 4 children. Isabel is 50 years old and lives in Segatic Diot, Clarin, Philippines.

Isabel is a farmer and grows coconut crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional coconuts to sell.

Isabel has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Isabel hopes to save for future consumption.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts to sell

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 31 years old and married with three children who are in school.

Merlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell like spices, soap, canned goods, soft drinks, milk, etc.

Merlinda has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Merlinda aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell like spices, soap, canned goods, soft drinks, milk, etc.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is married with 2 children. Maribel is 32 years old and lives in Segatic Diot, Clarin, Philippines.

Maribel is a farmer and grows corn crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers. 

Maribel has been a member of PMPC for 7 months. In the future, Maribel hopes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is widowed with 3 children. Caridad is 59 years old and lives in Maikay, Tudela, Philippines.

Caridad sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 8,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 35,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, soaps, etc.

Caridad has been a member of PMPC for 8 years.  In the future, Caridad hopes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle. Cecilia has been in this business for one year. She earns more income from a general store and food vending.

Cecilia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Eliza works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food-vending and motorcycle transport.  Eliza is borrowing PHP 4,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase materials needed for her tailoring business.

Eliza has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Haide

texts.en:
Haide is 41 years old, married, and has eight children. Seven of her children are in school. Haide has an agricultural business farming bananas in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Haide has been farming bananas for 20 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Haide would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Benkadi Vi Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe BENKADI VI sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelle à N’TESSONI, l’un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (Sikasso). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et le prêt passé a été bien remboursé.
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autre l’arachide, le mais et le pois sucré.
Avec  TCHIMITIO 1ère personne à droite de la photo position débout,avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des engrais  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 55.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The seven members of the Benkadi VI group are married women who on average are 37 years old, have three children and are all living in traditional families in N'Tessoni, one of the villages of the 3rd administrative region of Mali (Sikasso). They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better run their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their second agricultural farming loan with the institution and they repaid their past loan in full. The crops cultivated are among others, peanuts, corn and sweet peas. With Tchimito, the first person standing on the right side of the photo, with her loan, expects to buy fertilizers to maintain .5 hectares. Her output is sold at the village level and at the market after the harvest to a client base made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 55,000 FCFA by farming. This profit will allow her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants agricoles

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:

Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 85.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their second farm loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crops grown include peanuts, corn, and sweet peas, as is the case with MINATA, who is standing first from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase fertilizer to maintain 0.5 hectare. After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women in the village and at the market.

She plans on making a profit of 85,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, such as fertilizer

loans.name: Benkadi V Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI V sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 4enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelle à N’TESSONI, l’un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (Sikasso). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et le prêt passé a été bien remboursé.
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autre l’arachide, le mais et le pois sucré.
Avec  FATOUMATA 1ère personne à gauche de la photo position assise,avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des engrais  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 85.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The ten members of the Benkadi V group are married women who on average are 35 years old, have four children and are all living in traditional families in N'Tessoni, one of the villages of the 3rd administrative region of Mali (Sikasso). They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better run their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their second agricultural farming loan with the institution and they repaid their last loan in full. The crops cultivated are between peanuts, corn and sweet peas. Fatoumata, the first person in a seated position on the left side of the photo, with her loan, expects to buy fertilizers to maintain .5 hectares. Her output is sold at the village level and at the market after the harvest to a client base made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 85,000 FCFA by farming. This profit will allow her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural soil enrichment products.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.en:
Ceferina is widowed with 3 children. Ceferina is 64 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Ceferina is a farmer and grows corn fields to earn a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer.

Ceferina has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Ceferina hopes to expand her corn field someday.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Kodjovi

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 27ans, Kodjovi se bat chaque fois pour assurer une meilleure condition de vie à la famille. Pour cela, il a ouvert une boutique dans laquelle il revend des articles de quincailleries. Il s’approvisionne à Lomé et ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter plus de marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins de ses clients. Marié à une revendeuse et père de 02 enfants de 08 et 04ans tous scolarisés. Avec une ancienneté de quelques mois, il est âgé de 27ans.
texts.en: A young man of 27, Kodjovi is always working hard to ensure better living conditions for his family. For that reason, he opened a shop in which he buys and sells hardware. He buys his inventory in  Lomé and this first loan that he is requesting will permit him to buy more merchandise in order to respond to the needs of his customers. He is married to a small-scale merchant and the father of two children, 8 and 4 years old, both enrolled in school. With several months experience, he is 27 years old.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his hardware store

loans.name: Aneceta

texts.en:
Aneceta is 58 years old and married with eleven children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Aneceta is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy a new variety of seeds and pay laborers salary.

Aneceta has been farming rice for three years, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a new variety of seeds and pay laborers salary

loans.name: Ma. Tessie

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Ma. Tessie works hard to support her family.

She has a bakery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a motorcycle transport. Ma. Tessie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her bakery.

Ma. Tessie has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Soro Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Les trois membres du groupe SORO YIRIWA sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, 3 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à LOBOUGOULA, un des villages de la   3èmerégion administrative du Mali (Sikasso).
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.
Ils sont a leur deuxième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé. La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs. 
Pour MAHAMADOU au milieu de  la photo, avec son prêt, il compte acheter des engrais pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est divisée en deux partie une est réservée pour la nourriture et l’autre est vendue au niveau du village après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement des hommes.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 250.000FCFA  en fin de  campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The three members of the group SORO YIRIWA are married men, who, on average, are 30 years old and have three children each. They all live in traditional families at LOBOUGOULA, a village in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their second crop loan with the institution and the previous loan was fully repaid. The primary crop is corn.

MAHAMADOU (the middle of the photo) intends to use his loan for buy fertilizer to maintain two hectares. The crops are divided into two parts - one is reserved for food and the other is sold after harvest at the village to a clientele composed primarily of men. He earns an income of 250.000 f CFA at the end of the season. This income will enable him to repay his loan and help cover his family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Benkadi Vii Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe BENKADI VII sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelle à N’TESSONI, l’un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (Sikasso). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et le prêt passé a été bien remboursé.
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autre l’arachide, le mais et le pois sucré.
Avec  DIAMATIO 1ère personne à gauche de la photo position assise,avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des engrais  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 85.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The seven members of the Benkadi VII group are married women who on average are 37 years old, have three children and are all living in traditional families in N'Tessoni, one of the villages of the 3rd administrative region of Mali (Sikasso). They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better run their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their second agricultural farming loan with the institution and they repaid their past loan in full. The crops cultivated are, among others, peanuts, corn and sweet peas. With Diamatio, the first person in a seated position on the left side of the photo, with her loan, she expects to buy fertilizers to maintain .5 hectares. Her output is sold at the village level and at the market after the harvest to a client base made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 85,000 FCFA by farming. This profit will allow her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural soil enrichment products.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas está en su ciclo número 8 del programa de comité, una de las integrantes esta en el nivel uno del programa de eliminación de pobreza, lo cual quiere decir que esta con ingresos escasos, pero debe de seguir luchando por mejorar.
Ella es la Sra. Sandra, quien cuenta que vende ropas, de todo tipo para poder ir creciendo en sus ingresos y su emprendimiento y de esa forma poder ayudar a su familia. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y que está luchando por crecer.
La Sra. Sandra solicita de este crédito para la compra de ropas para damas y niños, lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres Unidas (United Women) is in its 8th communal bank cycle. One of the members is at level one of the poverty elimination program, which is to say that she has very little income, but she should continue fighting to improve.

She is Sandra, who says that she sells clothing of all kinds in order to be able to grow her income and her business and in that way be able to help her family. She is a very hard-working person and she is fighting to grow.

Sandra is asking for this loan to buy clothing for women and children. This will help her to carry out her business plan, which will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy clothing for women and children

loans.name: Noupagagnon  Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe NOUPAGAGNON II sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 6 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à N’GOLONIENA, un des villages de la   3èmerégion administrative du Mali (Sikasso).
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.
Ils sont a leur quatrième pret de campagne agricole avec l’institution et tous les prets précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs. 
Pour YACOUBA 1ère personne à droite de la  la photo, avec son prêt, il compte acheter des engrais pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est divisée en deux partie une est réservée pour la nourriture et l’autre est vendue au niveau du village et à Lobougoula après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement des hommes rarement aux femmes.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 200.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The four members of the group NOUPAGAGNON II are married men, who on average, are 40 years old and have six children each. They all live in traditional families at N'GOLONIENA, a village in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during rainy season. They are ready for their fourth growing season with the institution and all previous loans have been fully repaid. The primary crop is corn.

Yacouba (first person on the right) intends to use his loan to buy fertilizer to maintain two hectares. The crops are divided into two parts - one is reserved for food and the other is sold after harvest at the village and at Lobougoula to a clientele composed primarily of men (rarely women).

He earns an income of 200.000 f CFA at the end of the season. This income will enable him to repay his loan and help cover his family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita is widowed with 2 children.  Pablita is 63 years old and lives in Mialen, Clarin, Philippines.

Pablita sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month she earns 1,500 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, soaps, etc.

Pablita has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.  In the future, Pablita hope to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 59 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Tita is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Tita has been farming rice for thirty years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Noralyn works hard to support her family.

She has a rice farming business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.  Noralyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her rice farming business.

Noralyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rosally

texts.en:
Rosally is 35 years old, married and the mother of four children, who all attend school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Rosally has a personal products retail business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more personal products to sell.

Rosally has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more personal products to sell.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soft drinks, sugar, coffee, noodles, eggs, spices, etc. for her general store business.

Julie has been in this business for three years. Julie also earns income from farming vegetables and rice retailing.

Julie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soft drinks, sugar, coffee, noodles, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 49 years old, and married with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Raquel has a personal products retail business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like perfume, body lotion, shampoo, and other personal products.

Raquel has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like perfume, body lotion, shampoo, and other personal products.

loans.name: Benkadi Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf  membres du groupe BENKADI III sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelle à MISSANSO, l’un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (Sikasso). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et tous les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autre l’arachide, le mais et le piment.  
Avec  ASSETOU 2ème personne à gauche sur la photo position débout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des engrais  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 85.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The nine members of the group "BENKADI III" of the BENKADI association are married women, who average 35 years of age and three children each, all living in traditional families in MISSANSO, a village in the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali (Sikasso). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their sixth farm loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crops grown include peanuts, corn, and chili peppers, as is the case with ASSETOU, who is standing second from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase fertilizer to maintain 1 hectare. After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women in the village and at the market.

She plans on making a profit of 85,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, such as fertilizer

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Alegres es de Ciudad del Este, donde todas se unieron con el objetivo de poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo que todas hacen. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 de las integrantes están con ingresos muy bajos.
Natividad  en su  encuesta de eliminación de pobreza está dentro del nivel uno, es decir con ingresos muy bajos, pero se encuentra luchando por mejorar. Ella se dedica a la venta de dulces, con lo cual da a su familia lo que necesitan y se esfuerza cada día más. Ella hoy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de dulces para la venta y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando. Y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Mujeres Alegres [Happy Women] is based in Ciudad del Este, where the members banded together in order to help their families by working. Three members of Mujeres Alegres have very low incomes and are participating in the Poverty Elimination Survey [see explanation of "Poverty Spotlight" under "More information about this loan"]. 

In the context of the Poverty Elimination Survey, Natividad, having a very low income, is considered a "level-one" member. But she is striving to improve her situation. She works selling candy, business is improving by the day, and Natividad is able to meet her family's needs. She is applying this loan so she can invest the funds in the purchase of candy for sale and continue running her business - and supporting her family.

loans.use: to purchase candy for sale.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a hard working entrepreneur who has a buy and sell fruit business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional fruit to sell for her buy and sell fruit business.

Carmelita has been in this business for 15 years; she earns more income from selling vegetables.

Carmelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Virginia works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Virginia is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional charcoal to sell.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ana Fe

texts.en:
Ana Fe is 34 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Ana Fe has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for six years.
 
In the future, Ana Fe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Vhina

texts.en:
Vhina is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. She earns additional income by buying and selling charcoal.

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

Vhina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie works hard to support her family. Ana Marie is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Ana Marie requested a PHP 9,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc (NWTF) in order to buy ingredients for her food business. Ana Marie has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Ana Marie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
As a 47-year-old married woman, Rosalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a "buy and sell" charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. Rosalyn is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional charcoal to sell.

Rosalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lilia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Lilia is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials like wood and paints to repair her fishing boat.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials like wood and paints to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Teofie

texts.en:
Teofie is married with 2 children. Teofie is 43 years old and lives in Garang, Tangub, Philippines.

Teofie is a farmer and grows a rice field to earn a living. He has been doing this for 10 years. He has requested a loan to purchase rice grains. 

Teofie has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Teofie hopes to own a rice field someday.

loans.use: to purchase rice grains

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 33 years old and married with six children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Elvie has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle transportation business. Elvie has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Elvie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle transportation business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 39 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Elizabeth has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Nenilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nenilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Nenilyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Nenilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Kulbaira

texts.ru: Кулбайре 46 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Кулбайры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Кулбайра занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 200 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кулбайры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 3 овцы, а также имеет земельный надел размером 1 ГА, на которой ежегодно выращивает ячмень. Ежемесячный доход составляет 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кулбайра обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки коров. Доходы от кредита Кулбайра планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Kulbaira is 46 and married and, together with her husband, raising three children. She has a high school education and works in animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family, a business she started 20 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 200 KGS. Thanks to Kulbaira's hard work, her farm now includes one milk cow and three sheep as well as one hectare of agricultural land on which she grows barley every year. Her monthly earnings amount to 6,000 KGS.

With the goal of further development of her farm, Kulbaira has turned to microfinance bank "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 100,000 KGS to augment her number of cattle by purchasing cows. She plans to invest profits from the loan into further increasing her quantity of cattle, and in addition to save for home renovations.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.ru: Мухаммад энергичный молодой человек. Ему 18 лет. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Мухаммад в этом году окончил среднюю школу и поступил в Таджикский Национальный Университет. Он поступил в факультет Международное Отношение. Он с детства мечтал стать дипломатом. Мухаммад умный и начитанный человек. Он часто посещает библиотеку и смотрит интеллектуальные телепередачи. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор за 1 курс, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Muhammad is an energetic young man of 18. He is unmarried and lives with his parents. This year, Muhammad graduated from high school and applied to the Faculty of International Relations at Tajik National University. Since childhood, he has dreamed of becoming a diplomat. 

Muhammad is an intelligent and well-read person who often visits the library and watches intellectual television programs. He needs to pay for his first-year tuition but doesn't have the money. He is requesting a loan to pay for his tuition. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable farming business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and farming corn. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requested a new loan to further build her business. 

Marlyn is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies for her vegetable farming business.

Marlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Judima

texts.en:
Judima is 46 years old and married with seven children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Judima has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. Judima requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

In the future, Judima would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 35 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school.

Editha works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, noodles, soft drinks, etc.

Editha has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile load.

Editha aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, noodles, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support two children. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Josephine requested a PHP 4,600 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup lighting, in case of emergency.

Josephine is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
Hace 16 ciclos que están mujeres vienen trabajando juntas en el grupo llamado Renacer. Son mujeres muy sacrificadas, que se unieron con el objetivo de crecer, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para conocer el nivel de vida de cada una de ellas.
La Sra. Benicia, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel  dos, es decir con nivel medio de ingresos, que por medio de su esfuerzo y trabajo debe ir mejorando.  Entre el trabajo que ella hace se puede decir que vende mandioca cocinada por Kilo, como también la venta de gallinas, y con esto está mejorando.
Benicia solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de mandioca y también gallinas para la venta.
texts.en:
These women have been working together for 16 loan cycles in the group called "Renacer". They are very selfless women who came together with the objective of growing not only in the financial, but also in the personal sense. They are doing the survey on poverty elimination to know the standard of living of each of them. Benicia showed a poverty level at level two in their last survey; that is, with an average level of income that she must improve little by little through her work and effort.

One of the jobs she does is selling cooked yuca by the kilo as well as chickens, and with this is improving her circumstances. Benicia is requesting this loan to purchase yuca as well as chickens to sell.

loans.use: To buy yuca and chickens to sell.

loans.name: Namozaly

texts.ru: Намозали 62 года. Он женат и имеет 2 детей. Его старший ребенок учится в университете, а младший школьник. Намозали всегда старается для благо своей семьи. Он работает упорно и тратит свои деньги для своей семьи. Его старший сын учится в Аграрном Университете Таджикистана. Его сын трудолюбивый и умный молодой человек. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор своего сына, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора сына. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Namozaly is 62 and married with two children. His oldest child is a university student, and his youngest is in school. Namozaly always strives for the good of his family. He works hard and spends his money on his family. His oldest son is a hardworking and smart young man who studies at the Agrarian University of Tajikistan. Namozaly needs to pay for his son's tuition, but doesn't have the money. He is requesting a loan for his son's tuition. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for his son's education

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 46 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school.

Susana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase household stock to sell like chips, canned goods, milk, eggs, spices, etc.

Susana has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 9 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Susana aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase household stock to sell like chips, canned goods, milk, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad lives in Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental with her only child. She is a farmer and at the same time, she manages her piggery business to make a living. She has been in this business for five years, earning 3,750 PHP monthly. 

She borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC in order to buy feed for the livestock. She plans to renovate the livestock's shelter to be used for expansion.

Felicidad wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like eggs, shampoo, soap, chips, bread, etc. for her general store business.

Melanie has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from pre-paid mobile load.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like eggs, shampoo, soap, chips, bread, etc.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Elisa works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a buy-and-sell charcoal business. Elisa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase stocks to sell in her general store business, like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, and eggs.

Elisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stocks to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, and eggs.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 61 years old, a widowed mother of eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Lourdes has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Lourdes has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Lourdes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Luzvilla

texts.en:
Luzvilla is 54 years old, a widowed mother of three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Luzvilla has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Luzvilla requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Luzvilla has been in this business for two years. In the future, Luzvilla would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is a 43-year-old married man who lives in the small village of Akhalsheni with his wife, two sons and his mother-in-law. Ismail runs a small-scale agricultural business. In particular, he owns a citrus garden and a small dairy farm with two milk cows. Ismail and his family members work hard all day long to earn their living but their existing income is not enough to cover food and the every day expenses of such a large family. 

That is why Ismail decided to start his own business. All of the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, Ismail applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of a Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva. This program enables the vulnerable poor to start or re-start businesses. A loan of $2200 will help him to purchase a minibus, pay the duty for it, and install the seats. He will work on the minibus line and transport the passengers. The new business initiative will significantly increase the family funds.  With the increased income, he will be able to improve the living conditions of his family members.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus, pay the duty for it, and install seats to work on a minibus line

loans.name: Joryvic

texts.en:
Joryvic is 19 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Joryvic has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for one year. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

In the future, Joryvic would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 38 years old, married and the mother of five children. Four of her children are school age, and the elder son is 18 years old. The family lives in the mountainous area of the East Georgia, which attracts many tourists with the beautiful nature. 

Ana’s husband owns a car and serves the tourists during summertime. He transports shepherds in winter when the tourist season is over in return for a service fee. He has too many clients and doesn’t have enough time to serve them all. For this reason, the family decided to buy an additional car, and their elder son will work in same business.

With the received credit, Ana will purchase a secondhand car for her son to transport the tourists and generate income. There will be an additional person who makes money in the household, and Ana hopes her children will have an improved standard of living.

Ana hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase a car for her son to work in the transportation business.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.en: Four Latina women (Rosemery, Marjorie, Maria, Magdalena) worked together for two years to establish their own daycare cooperative, Semillitas, in Washington D.C. The daycare first opened its doors in January 2013 and currently serves 16 children.  Rosemery is applying for a $8,475 loan on behalf of the cooperative to purchase and install four smoke detectors at the daycare. In the future, the women would like to open a second daycare.

loans.use: to purchase and install smoke detectors

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn is 48 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a direct selling business with Avon and Personal Collection products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Edelyn has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the direct selling business with Avon and Personal Collection products  for five years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Edelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
As a parent of three children, Elsa works hard to support her family. She has a "buy and sell" rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Elsa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her business.

Elsa has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 38 years old and married, with five children who are in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for 13 years.   She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, soap, chips, and canned goods.

In the future Erlinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, soap, chips, and canned goods.

loans.name: Queen

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Queen works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from general store.  Queen is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock for her charcoal retailing business.

Queen has sustained her business activities through a previous loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving  money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Shaundrial

texts.en:
Shaundrial loves clothes and fashion and has a good eye for both.  Her business, Adores Boutique, offers the latest in women’s fashion, offering shoes, dresses, blouses, jewelry, accessories and many other items a person may purchase online at affordable prices.

Since Shaundrial began her online boutique more than nine months ago, she funded her business through her savings. Her long-term goal is to one day open a store front.  As her business expands, Shaundrial expects to create more jobs.

Currently, Shaundrial needs to purchase more inventory.  After a co-worker received a flyer from Accion Texas Inc., she turned to the nonprofit microlender for a business loan.  Once approved for her loan, Shaundrial was able to purchase fall styles, pay her one employee, and earn revenue through the remainder of the year.  The Accion loan allowed Shaundrial to pay for the maintenance of her website, www.adoresboutique.com.   Within the website, you can preview items and purchase the weekly updated merchandise online.

“Without the Accion loan, my business would move slower," Shaundrial says. "I would have to order less inventory.”

loans.use: to purchase fall styles, pay her one employee and pay for the maintenance of her website.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado primavera está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 5 de ellas necesitan seguir trabajando y luchando por crecer. Ellas tienen mucho optimismo de mejorar su economía y la de su familia para poder darles todo lo que necesitan.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gladys, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir con ingresos medios.  Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida, que con mucho esfuerzo ha podido montar y hacer crecer. Es una persona muy trabajadora que con su esfuerzo quiere ir dando a su familia lo mejor.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra insumos  para vender en su despensa, como ser comestibles, bebidas, carne y demás, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The “Spring” Group is making an effort to eliminate poverty, and 5 of them need to continue working and struggling to advance. These women have lots of optimism about improving their economic situation and that of their families if they are to provide everything they need.

Gladys is one of the members, and in her last survey, she demonstrated a poverty level of “2,” that is middle income. She has a well-stocked store that with great effort she has been able to supply and spur to growth. Gladys is a hard-working person who with her efforts, wants to continue providing her family with the best.

Gladys is requesting this loan to purchase merchandise to sell in her store, including food, drinks, meat, and other items. This will help her firm up her business plan and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy food, drinks, meat, and other items to sell.

loans.name: San Ramon Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Ramón Poty está en su ciclo número 10° Del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 9 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, eso quiere decir que están con ciertos indicadores de la encuesta muy bajos, especialmente el de ingresos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Margarita, quien  vio una gran oportunidad de crecimiento en el programa de comités, es por eso que se unió al grupo, buscando un mejor porvenir. Ella tiene una carpintería con muy buena clientela, y gracias a su trabajo ha dado a su familia todo lo que necesitan. Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de maderas, lo cual es su mayor insumo, y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando. Todas agradecen por la oportunidad que han recibido, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group San Ramon Poty is in its tenth cycle of a program headed by women, where everyone works and they all help each other succeed. They have been part of a survey studying the elimination of poverty and 9 of the members live below poverty line, which means that they find themselves in some of the lowest categories of the survey, especially in that of income. 
One of the members is named Mrs. Margarita, who sees this as a great opportunity for growth, which is why she joined. She is looking for a better tomorrow. She has a carpentry business and a good clientele and, thanks to the work that she does, her family has all that they need. She is asking for a loan so she can invest in purchasing more wood, which is her biggest need, and to be able to continue working.
Everyone is thankful for the opportunity they have been given, it will be big help.

loans.use: purchase wood and other carpentry supplies.

loans.name: Iuliia

texts.en:
Iuliia is a first-year student at the American University of Central Asia (AUCA). She considers AUCA one of the best universities in the Kyrgyz Republic as it has American standards of education, and she started to prepare for entrance exams long ago.

Iuliia’s family income is not high, as the only breadwinner in the family is her mother, so she is not able to afford full tuition at AUCA. She hopes to get financial support from Kiva, which will cover part of these expenses. 
 
Iuliia has been very active in her studies in school, participating at different Olympiads and other social events. She was a president of her group at high school where she had an active position. Also Iuliia has been awarded first places in city vocal competitions. In addition, she is a winner of a music contest among young performers, “Stream 2013,” that annually takes place at AUCA. So the above-mentioned experience could make her one of the best students at AUCA.
 
She considers the opportunity to study at AUCA an award for her excellent, hard-working and profound studies and her participation in different educational and social programs. Now she wants her dream to come true to study at one of the best universities in Central Asia.

loans.use: To cover higher education.

loans.name: Saadat

texts.en:
Saadat is a student at AUCA. This is her story.

My name is Saadat. I have a strong desire to study at the American University of Central Asia and am happy to be enrolled in the International and Comparative Politics Department. 

When I was a child, my family moved to Bishkek. It was quite difficult for me to get used to a new school, new people and environment, although not much later I became a leader of our class and started participating in the social life of our school actively. One of those was an event called “Young Traffic Wardens.” It was the most interesting activity I was ever involved in, because I was the leader of that team and had to make decisions quickly, which was a very good experience for me. 

I took part in another project called “Efficient use of water in schools.” It was the first experience with such a meaningful project. We have done a great job with my team preparing presentations as well as giving other administrative support to the project events. During the implementation of this project we met with such international organizations as OSCE and the Japanese Embassy. We had lots of discussions regarding that project and English proficiency helped us as much as practicing it. Likewise, I am one of the members of our school Parliament, where we organize different social events, such as competitions, concerts, etc.

All the above-mentioned experience makes me more confident to take an active part in extracurricular activities of AUCA in the future and do all my best to make a good contribution to the social life of AUCA. Moreover, my educational background will help me to learn new things easily.

But to pursue my degree at AUCA I need financial support from Kiva because I live in a family of seven, my parents and four siblings, where my father is the only breadwinner. He helps my grandfather in agriculture, which means that this is a seasonal work, so my father can’t afford covering the tuition fees fully. 

The reason I am applying for financial support is that I am the eldest child in the family. My two other siblings also study: my sister is becoming a student this year, and my brother is in eighth grade in high school. So financial aid would greatly help me to be more concentrated on the studies rather on how to earn money and cover my tuition fees.

loans.use: To pay for higher education.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 37 years old and married, with four children. Three of her children are in school.

Gina is a very hard working entrepreneur.  She has a business selling fish in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Gina has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Marzhana

texts.en:
Marzhana is a student at AUCA. This is her story.

My name is Marzhana. I have finished high school with golden medal this year. Only merit students are awarded the golden medal in the Kyrgyz Republic. I had excellent scores during my studies at high school and therefore I have been awarded the Diploma of Excellence each academic year. 

My strong educational background gave me an opportunity to succeed in entrance exams to AUCA's Business Law Department. 

I also took an active part in social life: In 2005 I was attending an art school, where I learned drawing very well. In 2007 I attended at the School of Music, where I learned vocal. I also have experience in dancing, and eventually I became an instructor at one of the dancing clubs, Let’s Dance Studio. As AUCA gives a good opportunity to take part in social and extracurricular activities, my experience will allow me to play an active role in it.

At our school there also was an organized club of debaters, where I took an active part. As a result I was awarded the title “The best debater of the school.”

I am sure all the above-mentioned experience I gained during my studies will give me an opportunity to become a valuable student at AUCA. 

I live in a family of four: my mother, my sister, my cousin and I. The only breadwinner of my family is my mother. She works at the Ministry of Justice. My older sister is also a student and studies at the National University of Kyrgyz Republic. Her studies are also expensive, so it would be difficult for my mother to fully cover my tuition fees. My cousin, whose mother lives and works in Moscow, also lives with us, and my mother is the one taking care of him. He is a student of eighth grade. 

I believe that American University of Central Asia is my future and I hope to get a financial support, which will allow me to cover my tuition fees.

loans.use: To pay for higher education.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a student at AUCA. This is her story.

My name is Diana. This year I have graduated from my high school – Aychurok Kyrgyz-Turkish girls’ school. For most of the students the last year of school is the most crucial, as they have to decide what they are going to do in their life and choose the place to study that fits them the best. However, for me it wasn’t a difficult task since I had already decided that AUCA is the best place for my higher education. It is obvious that this university is one of the most prestigious, not only in our country, but also in the whole Central Asia.

I learned about AUCA when I was only in seventh grade. I decided to enroll at AUCA after high school. Since then I improved the level of my English language proficiency, because this is one of requirements of AUCA. 

I think I fully meet AUCA requirements and really hope to get financial aid from Kiva, because it is unaffordable for my family to cover it fully.

As far as I know, the student life of AUCA is very vivacious and interesting. I am the one who always takes part in social life. I think I will be able to contribute to the social life of AUCA, making it more colorful and enjoyable, which will be a very good experience for me too. Moreover, I am a very diligent and determined student, and I am sure that I will be able to learn new subjects without any difficulties.

Now I am on the final step to reach my goal. I would really admire your understanding my situation and providing financial aid.

loans.use: To pay for higher education.

loans.name: Daria

texts.en:
Daria is a student at AUCA. This is her story.

My name is Daria. I have been accepted to the Undergraduate Program in Software Engineering at the American University of Central Asia. I scored 555 in TOEFL, 79 in mathematics and 83 in Essay, which means that I am scored in the top of 5% of all AUCA exam takers. I am asking you to provide me financial assistance because of the reason specified below.

I live in a family of three: my mother, my brother and I. My mother is the only person taking care of our family. Therefore it is difficult for her to cover the tuition fees. 
I thought very thoroughly before I decided where I want to study. I know that AUCA is more than just a university. It gives students more than just knowledge. It gives a completely different understanding of life and helps to open students' minds. I believe that studying at AUCA will give me an excellent academic knowledge, technical skills and personal attributes that will help me to succeed in all my future endeavors. I am honored to be accepted by such a prestigious university.

However, without any financial aid I will not be able to be part of it. I would be very grateful if you consider my candidacy for scholarship and give me an opportunity to acquire knowledge and also to realize my ambitions at AUCA.

loans.use: To pay for higher education.

loans.name: Stanislav

texts.en:
Stanislav is a first-year student of the American University of Central Asia and this is his story.

Stanislav graduated a private high school in Bishkek this year. It was his dream to enroll at AUCA, and fortunately he had a chance to get admitted to the Business Administration Department at AUCA. His scores on the entrance exams are quite good, which means that Stanislav is ready to study at such a university.
 
His mother always tried her best to give her children the best education, but she can’t afford paying the tuition fees fully, as she is the only employee in their family. Thus Stanislav hopes to get financial support from Kiva, which could partially cover his expenditures. He also has a sister, who studies at a private school and his mother pays for her studies too. If Kiva supports him, it will give him a chance to be concentrated on studies and not on how to earn money for studies. 

Stanislav’s mother used to tell her children that the best investment is an investment in education. Therefore, Stanislav even enrolled in the preparatory courses at AUCA last year, which makes him ready to be one of the strong students of AUCA. He hopes to get this opportunity as AUCA is one of the best universities in Kyrgyzstan.

loans.use: To pay for higher education.

loans.name: Bekzat

texts.en:
Bekzat is a student at AUCA. This is his story.

My name is Bekzat. I am from Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan. I enrolled at American University of Central Asia (AUCA) as it is the best university in my country and provides a high-quality education. Since AUCA is accredited by Bard College, students get American diplomas.
 
It is difficult for my family to cover the tuition fee, though. My family paid for my brother to attend AUCA. It is very hard for them to find more money for my studies. As the second child, I don’t have as many opportunities, but I still want the best education I can get. 

The other argument would be my promise to the university that I will meet the expectations of the university. I will not limit myself only by studying, but also actively take part in the social life of AUCA. I am a creative, emotionally stable and very active person. I consider these skills very important for extracurricular activities of AUCA. I know that the university has a lot of extracurricular activities where I will have a chance to demonstrate my skills and abilities.

I was a very active student at school. I was a member of pupillary senate where I got good grades, studied French and was engaged in sports.
My mother always talks about the importance of education. Therefore I always tried to be one of the best students at high school, which gave me a chance to enter AUCA. I would much appreciate financial support to pursue my studies.

loans.use: To pay for higher education.

loans.name: Aidai

texts.en:
'Education is our passport to the future, for tomorrow belongs to the people who prepare it today.' Malcolm X, African-American Muslim Minister and Human Rights activist."

This is how Aidai started her essay applying for financial aid to the American University of Central Asia, where she is a first-year student. Aidai is sure that education is vital in life and this is what she is convinced of from being involved in the school experience that she had. 

Aidai wants to study at the American University of Central Asia, as it gives the best  education in Central Asia. At the same time, she wonders about the financial part of this issue, as her family cannot afford paying the tuition fees. But she doesn’t want money to stop her from her studies.
 
Aidai tries to be helpful to her parents and save money to partially cover her tuition fees, and this summer she is planning to work as a tourist guide for foreigners, which is also a good opportunity and experience for English speaking students. A Kiva loan would let Aidai be more concentrated on her studies, not on thinking about how to earn money for her tuition. 

The American University of Central Asia has been the university of her dreams for years and she doesn’t want financial restrictions to be a barrier for her future success.

loans.use: To pay for higher education.

loans.name: Santa Rita De Casia Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Rita de Casia  está en su ciclo número 7 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante.  Ellas a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ellas se encuentran mejorando su situación.
Justina una de las integrantes se dedica a la venta de leche, y comenta que es muy sacrificado su trabajo, ya que empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas en la mañana, ya que debe de dejar su producto para la hora del desayuno. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que se está esforzando por crecer y salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar más leche y seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
The communal bank Santa Rita de Casia is in its 7th loan cycle with the women's program. The members work and help each other get ahead. They utilize best practices for successful women in their work and are improving their circumstances. 

Justina, one of the members, sells milk and says she is dedicated to her job. She begins early in the morning, as she has to deliver her merchandise for breakfast. She is hardworking and strives to grow her business and get ahead. She has applied for a loan to buy more milk and continue working. She is thankful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
La clienta tuvo un buen desempeño, cumplió con el plan de pagos establecidos, tiene una gran trayectoria crediticia en la fundación, por su excelente moral de pago y buena gestión y manejo de los créditos recibidos.
Ella manifiesta que con su negocio, ha logrado ser una mejor persona, ha podido cumplir sus metas propuestas. Y apoya el estudio de sus hijos.
Nuevamente ella solicita el crédito para cubrir gastos de su tratamiento odontológico y chequeos médicos.
texts.en: The client did a good job and complied with the payment schedule. She has an excellent credit history with the foundation and has managed her payments and loans well. She says she has become a better person through her business and has been able to achieve her goals and help pay her children's education expenses. She has applied for a new loan to cover her dental treatment and medical checkups.

loans.use: to do an upper abdomen ultrasound and gastroscopy and to buy medications.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 37 years old, married and has three children who are in school.  

Lolita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lolita requested a loan of PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy additional pigs to raise, as well as feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lolita has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs to raise, as well as feeds and vitamins for her pigs
