Son premier crédit lui permettra de stocker plus de marchandises afin de mieux servir ses clients. Elle espère agrandir l’activité et se marier plus tard. Elle a une ancienneté de 02ans.
texts.en: A young woman, Ayoko is 21 years old, and to support herself, she sells hair extensions and clothing in her store. Her first loan will enable her to stock up on more merchandise in order to serve her customers better. She hopes to expand her business and to get married later on. She has two years of seniority.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions, jewelry, and clothing to sell in her store

loans.name: Dovi

texts.fr: Veuve de 55ans, ayant en charge 05 enfants dont 01 scolarisé, Dovi se bat pour apporter du bonheur à ses enfants en vendant du charbon, du mais et ignames à son domicile. Il désire renforcer son activité en gardant ses clients c’est pour cela, elle sollicite un premier prêt à WAGES. Son souhait est d’assurer l’avenir de ses enfants et garder son activité durable.
texts.en: A widow, Dovi is 55 years old and has five children, of whom one is in school. Dovi struggles to bring happiness to her children by selling charcoal, corn, and yams out of her home. She would like to bolster her business by keeping her customers. For this reason, she is requesting an initial loan from WAGES. Her wish is to ensure her children's future and to keep her business sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal, yams, and corn to sell

loans.name: Komivi

texts.fr: Célibataire de 31ans, Komivi revend des pièces détachées. Pour mieux répondre aux besoins des clients, il sollicite un prêt à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises. Il s’approvisionne au Nigeria et à Lomé. Il espère avec le profit agrandir son activité et ouvrir un cyber. Komivi a une ancienneté de 08ans.
texts.en: Unmarried and 31 years old, Komivi sells replacement parts. To respond better to the needs of his customer, he is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase some merchandise. He gets his supplies from Nigeria and in Lomé. With the profits, he hopes to expand his business and open an internet café. Komivi has eight years of seniority.

loans.use: to purchase replacement parts to sell

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo works hard to support her family. She is married and has a beauty salon business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 35 years now. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

Amparo has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years, and also earns income from raising pigs. She is borrowing 30,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell through her vending business.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Anabella

texts.en:
Anabella is 43 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, Anabella works very hard to provide for them.

Anabella runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, cooking oil, sugar, laundry soap, etc. to sell in her general store.

Anabella has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, cooking oil, sugar, laundry soap, etc. 

In the future Anabella would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Elcita

texts.en:
Elcita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business making dried fish in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now. Elcita has requested a loan of 22,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy additional fish to process into dried fish to sell.

In the future, Elcita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to process into dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 50 years old and married with three children.

Lucita works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for ten years and also earns an income from direct selling of avon and natasha products. She has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan, and is currently requesting a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy additional items like rice, orange juice, soft drinks, soap, groceries, etc. to sell. 

Lucita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like rice, orange juice, soft drinks, soap, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Cheril

texts.en:
Cheril is 38 years old and married with four children; three children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Cheril has a vegetables and spices vending business in the Philippines. Cheril requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables and spices to sell.

Cheril has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Cheril would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 53 years old and married with one child.

Flora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell like snack foods, biscuits, candies, soft-drinks, noodles, etc. in her general store.

Flora has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Flora aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Kerstine

texts.en:
Kerstine is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Kerstine is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Kerstine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 39 years old and married with two children.

Alma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like can goods, milk, sugar, soap, chips, etc.

Alma has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear and cosmetics products.

Alma aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like can goods, milk, sugar, soap, chips, etc.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 55 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy additional items like eggs, sugar, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Corazon has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling bananas and raising livestock.

Corazon aspires to saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like eggs, sugar, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, four of whom are in school, Edelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business as a mobile fish vendor in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Edelyn is borrowing 30,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy additional fish like tulingan, galunggong, lapu-lapu, milk fish, etc. to sell as part of her mobile fish-vending business.

Edelyn has been sustaining her business activities through 21 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish like tulingan, galunggong, and lapu-lapu to sell.

loans.name: Lidia Lissette

texts.es:
Lidia, le surge la necesidad de optar por un nuevo crédito para continuar trabajando en su negocio de venta de comida; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar los productos necesarios, tales como: carnes, pollo, pescado, verduras, condimentos, bebidas, conchas, entre otros.
Cuenta la Sra. Lidia que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus inventarios y con ello se han obtenido mayores ingresos. Las circunstancias familiares se mantienen, mientras que las condiciones económicas han mejorado.
texts.en:
Lidia is in need of a new loan to continue with her business of selling food. This investment will help her purchase necessary products such as beef, chicken, fish, vegetables, condiments, drinks, conch etc…

Lidia says that the previous loan helped her to increase her inventory and with it she was able to obtain higher revenue. Her family situation remains the same while her economic one has improved.

loans.use: to purchase beef, chicken, fish, vegetables, condiments, drinks, conch etc…

loans.name: Estrella De San Gabriel Group

texts.en:
The women of the Estrella de San Gabriel are entering the second nine month cycle of Namaste business advice, financial education and a small loan.  They all did very well in the first nine month cycle.  Most of the women in this group, from the very small town of San Gabriel, Suchitepequez, have tortilla making businesses and one woman sells other food items. Only one woman in the group can read and write.  The women have made good progress with their businesses as Namaste is the first organization to give them the opportunity to learn how to manage their business and their money, in addition to offering microcredit.

María Cristina, second from the left in the photo, is a 37 year old mother of two children, one in school and one still too young for school.  With her business, making and selling tortillas, she is able to send her children to school.  She has had this business for seven years. During her first nine months with Namaste she moved her business from a stall in the central market in the nearby city of Mazatenango to a stall she rents in the bus terminal in her small town of San Gabriel.  With her new loan of she plans to buy a wood table on which to put her tortilla baskets and she will also buy in bulk the corn for the tortillas and the wood for cooking them. 
Currently she sells about 28,000 tortillas in a month, and her business plan for the next nine months has her selling 7,000 more, including sales at breakfast time.  Her projections are that over these nine months, when she can buy her materials in bulk, she will increase her monthly sales from the current Q5,600 (US $718) to Q7,000 (US $897) with a profit of Q2,656 (US $340).

loans.use: A portion of the Estrella de San Gabriel (St Gabriel’s Star) group will be used by María Cristina to buy in bulk raw materials to make tortillas

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru: Елена замужем. Она работает вместе со своим мужем, который занимается ремонтами - кладка кафеля, поклейка обоев, установка гипсокартона, замена окон, прочее. Елена просит предоставить ей кредит на замену забора вокруг дома. Нынешний забор старый, поломался. Ремонтировать его нет смысла, надо менять весь. Елена хочет поменять старый поломанный залбор на новый и красивый, который будет радовать глаза и служить защитой для ее дома.
texts.en: Yelena is married and she works with her husband who performs home repairs such as laying tiles, wallpapering, drywall installation and window replacement.  She is requesting a loan to replace the fence around her house.  Her current fence is old and broken, and it doesn't make sense to repair it, it needs to be replaced entirely.  Yelena wants to replace her old broken fence with a new one which will not only be beautiful and great to look at, but will also offer good protection for her house.

loans.use: to put a new fence around her house.

loans.name: Koku

texts.fr: Homme de 50ans, Mr Koku est marié à une couturière et père de 04 enfants. Les deux plus jeunes (25 et 10ans) sont scolarisés. Il a appris comme métier la couture et s’est plus spécialisé dans la broderie. A la fin de son apprentissage, il a ouvert son atelier en 1985. En plus de son activité principale, il revend bazins. Pour renforcer son stock, il fait sa toute première demande à WAGES. Le profit permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille et rendre pérenne l’activité.
texts.en: A 50-year-old man, Mr. Koku is married to a clothier, and he is the father of four children. The two youngest (15 and 10) are in school. Mr. Koku learned how to sew as a trade and is now specialized in embroidery. Upon finishing his apprenticeship, he opened his own workshop in 1985. In addition to his main work, he sells damask fabrics retail. To bolster his stock, he is taking out his first loan from WAGES. The profits will enable him to improve his family's living conditions and to make his business sustainable.

loans.use: tp purchase damask fabrics for producing clothing

loans.name: Anoumou

texts.fr: Propriétaire de centre de jeux. Anoumou âgé de 31ans est marié et père de famille. Il est aidé par 01 personne et désire acheter deux postes téléviseurs et des consoles PS pour mieux satisfaire ses clients. Il espère améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en: The owner of a video games center, Anoumou, 31 years old, is married and the father of a family. He is helped by one person and would like to purchase two TV sets and some PS consoles to satisfy his customers further. He hopes to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase TV sets and consoles for his games arcade.

loans.name: Edith Melene

texts.es: Edith una joven de 22 años que estudia y trabaja, la cual cursa en 4to ciclo del curso de inglés. Desde muy joven siempre le gustaron los idiomas, muestra de ello es que es una de las primeras en su aula.  Actualmente se desempeña como auxiliar en un colegio, gracias a este trabajo puede  solventar los gastos del instituto. Agradece a sus padres pues siempre la motivaron a salir adelante. Su mayor deseo es de culminar satisfactoriamente su carrera, pues al concluir piensa seguir estudiando otros idiomas como el francés y el portugués. El crédito que solicitó lo invertirá para el pago de sus estudios. Edith agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada y motiva a seguir ayudando a otros jóvenes como ella.
texts.en:
Edith, 22, goes to school and works.  She's in her fourth semester of the English program.  She has loved languages since she was a little girl.  Proof of this is that she's one of the top students in her class.

Currently Edith works as an assitant in a school.  Thanks to this job she's able to make her tuition payments.  She's grateful to her parents because they always motivated her to get ahead.  Her biggest desire is to finish her program satisfactorily.  When she's done she plans to study other languages, such as French and Portuguese.

The loan she requested is to pay for her studies.

Edith thanks the Kiva lenders for their help and motivation to continue helping other young people like her.

loans.use: to pay her monthly expenses

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is a people person. He worked at the post office for several years and was recognized for his excellent customer service. When a medical condition forced Oscar to leave his job over two years ago, he began his carpet cleaning business.

Oscar enjoys interacting with customers and takes pride in a completing a job well done. What sets his business apart from the rest is his prompt and friendly service, as well as his attention to detail and high quality of work. 

This loan will be used to purchase equipment for Oscar's business, specifically a heavy duty dirt extractor. Right now he works alone, but Oscar’s goal is to be able to employ others and to help them take care of themselves and their families, just as he was able to do for his.

loans.use: To purchase a dirt extractor for his carpet business

loans.name: Catarina

texts.en:
Catarina grew up in Portugal and came to the States when she was 13 years old. She worked as a paralegal for seven years before starting her business, Docerela. 

Today, Catarina’s company is the first of its kind to offer handmade Portuguese acrylic stamps. As a single mother, Catarina said, keeping in touch with her family in Portugal was what inspired her to start this business. She currently has distributors at two stores in Brazil and one in Portugal.

Though she is self-taught, Catarina has a natural eye for design. Her goal is to expand her online business into a storefront in Union, New Jersey. The loan will be used to help purchase equipment for the storefront, including fixtures and desks. A talented baker, Catarina would eventually like to sell cupcakes at her shop as well.

loans.use: To help move Catarina's online business into a storefront

loans.name: Wislet

texts.en:
Wislet is a certified electronic engineer with a passion for his work. Originally from Haiti, he gained his education and experience from years of working in the telecommunications field. For the past seven years, he has been working on projects for major network providers, such as T-Mobile and AT&T.  

Wislet’s specialty is building cell phone towers. He needs money to execute contracts that cost upwards of $30,000 to secure. Reliable vehicles and labor are expensive. Though the scope of work differs with each contract, crews typically require at least four people, and at least one must be a certified climber.  The money from this loan will go toward these expenses.

Looking forward, Wislet hopes to hire five teams of at least five people to work with him. His goal is to help people by providing more jobs and allowing them to support themselves and their families.

loans.use: To pay for labor and equipment to secure contracts

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel was born in Ecuador and has been in the US for 11 years. One of his three children was hospitalized in intensive care for one year, and without insurance, it was difficult to provide for his family. Manuel had to find a way to make ends meet, so he became a business owner.

Manuel loves the kitchen and loves his work.  He knows he is good at what he does.  One year ago, when he received a large amount of money, he immediately invested it into his current space in Hightown, New Jersey. 

El Paraiso is Manuel’s restaurant. Working in a variety of restaurants with different cultures for over eight years, Manuel learned how to cook in many different styles. What separates his cooking from others is the authenticity and diversity of his food. 

Manuel’s goal is to have the “American dream,” to be able to provide for his children and sustain his business in the long run. The loan will be used to purchase and renovate a larger space that can accommodate more customers, as well as more equipment in the kitchen and more tables.

loans.use: to purchase and renovate a larger space for his restaurant

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 47 years old, married and has four children, two of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. 

Josephine has been farming rice for 10 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 43 years old and single. She works very hard to provide for her family. 

Lorna runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, eggs and other miscellaneous items. 

Lorna has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future Lorna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mahender

texts.en:
Mahender (“Mike”) came to the States in 1981 from India. He moved to Edison, NJ after getting married in 1992. Mike gained experience in the wholesale business while studying in Mumbai, where he started a small export business as a college student.

Now Millennium Fashions, Mike’s online wholesale website, has been in business for over 15 years. With this loan, he plans to expand his business by improving product lines and investing in better marketing in order to attract more traffic online. Mike says he receives many sales inquiries, but is not able to satisfy the demand. Buying in bulk will allow him to operate at the level required.

Mike is excited about the future of his business. He finds more people are buying gifts online, and he believes that consumers will appreciate the authenticity and affordability of the products he sells.  

He looks forward to working with his son, who is studying finance at the county college, and his daughter, who just graduated high school, to continue the business he has worked so hard to create.

loans.use: to improve product lines and invest in better marketing in order to attract more traffic online

loans.name: Sabougnouma 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  NAGNASSONI, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le sorgho  avec   WARABA  debout au milieu sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les semences et les intrants  pour entretenir 1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 70.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "SABOUGNOUMA 2" are married women, who average 33 years of age and five children each, all living in polygamous families in NAGNASSONI, a village in SIKASSO, the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their third farm loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is sorghum, as is the case with WARABA, who is standing in the middle in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase seeds and farm inputs to maintain 1.5 hectares. After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women in the village in SIKASSO.

She plans on making a profit of 70,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and seeds

loans.name: Sabougnouma 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à NAGNASSONI, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le sorgho  avec   ADIARATOU au milieu sur la photo des debout. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les semences et intrants  pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 125.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

The members of the group "SABOUGNOUMA 3" are married women, who average 33 years of age and five children each, all living in polygamous families in NAGNASSONI, a village in SIKASSO, the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their third farm loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is sorghum, as is the case with ADIARATOU, who is standing in the middle in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase seeds and farm inputs to maintain 1.5 hectares. After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women in the village in SIKASSO.

She plans on making a profit of 125,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm input and seeds

loans.name: Sabougnouma 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à NAGNASSONI, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le sorgho  avec  AWA  debout au milieu sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les semences et les intrants  pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 150.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "SABOUGNOUMA 4" are married women, who average 34 years of age and five children each, all living in polygamous families in NAGNASSONI, a village in SIKASSO, the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their third farm loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is sorghum, as is the case with AWA, who is standing in the middle in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase seeds and farm inputs to maintain 1.5 hectares. After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women in the village in SIKASSO.

She plans on making a profit of 150,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and seeds

loans.name: Kyeera Gamba Nokora Group

texts.en:
Joy, a married woman with seven children, is hard-working and dedicated. She has acquired several loans which have enabled her to educate her children as well as meet her daily family needs. She wants this loan to use it to buy a cow which she will graze and later get milk to sell and for her family nourishment.
She thanks the group members for being there for each other and also growing their businesses and repaying well. The group thanks Kiva for partnering with them. They are hard-working and honest.
Joy appears as fourth from the left, all the group members appear in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy cows and also hire labour to fence the land

loans.name: Kalerwe Tulla Tda- Godfrey Group

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 47 year-old taxi driver and a member of Kalerwe Tulla TDA.  He is a father of three, all of whom attend school. Godfrey started this business in 1998 when he recognized that people in the city outskirts did not have proper means of transport to and from the city center.  However, Godfrey for these many years has been employed by Yasin. Because of Godfrey's honesty and hard work, Yasin is willing to sell his brand new taxi to him at a relatively cheaper price.
Godfrey, therefore, needs a loan to complete the payment for this taxi before the agreed date. The owner will sell it to someone else if he fails to find the money. In this situation, Godfrey urgently needs a loan before he misses out on the opportunity.

loans.use: To top up on payment for a taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of his son's tuition at Abaarso School of Science and Technology.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of his son's secondary school tuition.

loans.name: Carla

texts.en:
Carla is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years.  

Carla has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy kitchenware for her restaurant.

Carla dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy kitchenware for her restaurant.

loans.name: Anamir

texts.en:
Anamir is 59 years old, married and has four children, one of whom is in school. 

Anamir is in the agricultural business, raising cows in the Philippines. She has been raising cows for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. 

Anamir has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her cows. In the future, Anamir would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her cows.

loans.name: Kyenzige Sacco Group

texts.en:
Josephine is 44-years-old. She is a widow with five children aged 14, 16, 18, 20 and 23 years respectively. Because she has to pay school fees, only two of her children attend school. Josephine operates a small bar as her major source of income, in Kyenzige, on the outskirts of Kagadi.

Josephine has applied for a loan of ugx.500,000 Ugandan Shillings to buy stock for her bar business so that she increase her earnings from the business to meet her family's needs. Josephine's dream is to buy a piece of land to construct a permanent residential house for the family and also to educate all of her children in the higher institutions of learning.

Josephine's major challenge is the limited source of income she has to achieve her dream. She is grateful that Kiva, through UGAFODE, is interested in supporting her business.

The chairperson of the group who is seated has a running loan and is not taking a loan with this sub-group but signed the waiver form.

loans.use: to buy beverages to sell in her business.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

Roselyn has been in this business for 30 years. Roselyn earns more income from buying and selling fish and farming rice.

Roselyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 41 years old. Her husband died in 1998 and left her with two children to look after. She has been struggling to pay their tuition since both of them are now at the university .She has requested ugx.2,500,000 to help her children go back to the university since the semester is starting next week. She is doing a business raising goats, for which she will earn money to pay back the loan.She is thankful to the kiva lenders through Ugafode for contributing to the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase more goats to raise and sell

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a second-time borrower of the institution, and is applying for ugx.3,000,000 Ugandan shillings. He is a married man, aged 42 years, working as a human resource manager of Makerere University Kampala. He says he is not paid enough money, and he is looking at resigning to concentrate on agriculture, which has always been his side source of income. 

He now has 4 acres of land, and on it, just 1.5 acres have a banana plantation, and the other portion is underutilized. The purpose for the loan is to use it to clear the un utilized portion of land to plant maize and beans on it and also pay the workers. Given the loan, he will hire laborers to help clear the land and plant the crops now that it has started raining. He is assured of ready market, and he can later concentrate on agriculture for survival in the near future, especially after retiring.In the photo is the the client and the Ugafode credit officer(right to left).

loans.use: To hire laborers.

loans.name: Nyabikungu Kwetungura Women's Group

texts.en: Nyabikungu Kwetungura women’s group is located on the outskirts of Mbarara town. The group is comprised mainly of women whose major activity is agriculture. They fall into different categories of divorcees, widows, single mothers, and a few who are married. Annet, a resident of rural Rugando (a suburb in Mbarara municipality), is aged 44. She did not go far in education so she started commercial farming in order to survive and also to cater for her family. This business grew and helped her to sustain the family and contribute to the education of her children. She later obtained a loan of UGX 400,000 from Ugafode microfinance which has helped her to prosper, which motivated her to mobilize her colleagues to form a development group called Nyabikungu Kwetungura women. This group is very determined to change each member’s life and has succeeded in many developmental projects, however there has been a lot of challenges and because of that they are requesting a loan of UGX 5,000,000 (the whole group) to help them plough land and increase their working capital for their different business.

loans.use: To hire machinery for ploughing the land

loans.name: Desire

texts.en:
Desire is 36 years a resident of Katende Maya LC1 zone. 

Desire has a mini super market dealing in daily use household items, food stuffs and beverages in a slightly busy market in the outskirts of the city.She started this business three years ago as source of income after she had failed to find a job. She started this business as a way of supporting her family since she is the sole bread winner of the entire family.

Desire’s business is strategically located but her major challenge is inadequate capital. This hinders her ability to buy enough stock for her business and also hinders its growth and expansion, hence her request to be funded.
Her neighbours recommended her for being a hardworking, determined and cooperative person in the community.

loans.use: To buy items for sale in the retail shop.

loans.name: Zion Christian Association2 Group

texts.en:
Jessica is a 40-year-old woman with five children who all go to school. She is a married woman and a resident of Entebbe. She is a second-time borrower and has been servicing a loan of UGX 500,000 during the previous cycle, and which she repaid well. 

However, she now wants to borrow UGX 1,000,000 . She wishes to borrow more money from Ugafode Microfinance in order to finance her small poultry farm by buying feed and young chicks. She is so grateful to the funders for the help they provide to the low-income earners like her fellow group members who cannot borrow from big banks since they don’t have security to secure their loans.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and chicks.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Beatriz works hard to support her family. She has a vulcanizing business in the Philippines. (Vulcanizing converts rubber to more durable materials.) She earns additional income from raising livestock.

Beatriz has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her vulcanizing shop. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her vulcanizing shop.

loans.name: Jesserie

texts.en:
Jesserie is 22 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising cows in the Philippines. Jesserie has been raising cows for four years and also earns additional income from a restaurant.

Jesserie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her cow. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her cows.

loans.name: Kasenyi United New-Monika Group

texts.en:
Ms.Monika is 44 years old, married and has five children with one dependent. She is a member of Kasenyi United group and has been a member of the group for the last five years. She is in the fishing business which she started doing in the year 1994 and she was very optimistic that the business would grow and fetch enough money as profits. 

Monika picked interest in the business because it was the most rewarding business in the area since they are near a lake. The business is located in Kasenyi, near the landing site in Kasese District. She gives this business enough time and on average, she gives it eight hours in a day and while off the fishing business, she attends to a bar which is her other source of income. She plans to use the loan money (5,000,000 uganda shillings) for buying fish nets and boats so that she is able to catch more fish and have increased sales and hence high profits. 

Her clients are people from Kasese and those in far off areas since she takes the fish to other places for sale. For the time she has been in the fishing Industry, Monika says her main challenge has been transport which is really poor since the roads are bad and this increases the transport fares and in the long run cuts her profits. Her other challenge, is the influence from the government since it some times bars them (fishermen) from fishing in that lake. 

However despite the challenges, Monika says she will keep being the hard-working person she has always been so that she one day owns a plot of land. She thanks Ugafode and Kiva lenders for the support they have been giving to the group.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and boats.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 57 years old and widowed. She works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store in the Philippines for 10 years and also earns an income from rice retailing and raising livestock.

Lilia has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has now requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like shampoo, snack food, sardines and school supplies to sell.

Lilia hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items like shampoo, snack food, sardines and school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 24 years old, married and has one child who is in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Beverly has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Beverly has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Hanelie

texts.en:
Hanelie is 50 years old and married with 10 children, five of whom are in school. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines which she has been doing for 15 years.

Hanelie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Ma. Emily

texts.en:
Ma. Emily is 32 years old and married with two children. She has been in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, for the past six years now. 

Ma. Emily has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva to sustain her business. She has now requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Emily is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 31 years old, married with 4 children and only 2 attend school. He operates a small retail business as a source of income to look after the family and also practices agriculture for commercial and home consumption on a small scale basis.

Paul approached UGAFODE for a loan of ugx.1,000,000(One million Ugandan shillings) to restock his retail business.  This will help him meet the demand in the area since there are a few retail shops in the area and the population is quite high.

Paul's dreams are to construct a permanent residential house using proceeds from the business and to educate the children.  However, his major challenges are those who buy on credit and never pay as well as the seasonality in business which affects his cash flow.  Paul is a hardworking and honest person.  He thanks Kiva lenders for the vision of supporting the poor.

loans.use: To buy retail stock to sell

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe, es una mujer de 52 años de edad. Se a dedicado desde muy pequeña al trabajo, ya que tenia que madrugar para preparar los alimentos que llevaba su padre y sus hermanos cuando iban a trabajar la agricultura; luego tenia que ayudar a su madre en los quehaceres del hogar. A sus 18 años se caso y empezó a trabajar la agricultura en compañía de su esposo, de este matrimonio procrearon 6 hijos, con mucho esfuerzo les pudo dar el estudio solo de primaria, todos sus hijos se acompañaron y se retiraron de su casa es poco la ayuda que reciben de ellos. Ademas, de sus hijos tiene una hija adoctiva.

Ella en compañía de su esposo trabajan la agricultura, siembran 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y una de jicama. Estos cultivos, los cosechan desde que se caso hace varios años, ademas para ayudar a los gastos familiares compra algunos productos básicos para consumo para revenderlos. La única que le ayuda es la hija adoctiva, quien trabaja como empleada en la alcaldía municipal quien esta siempre pendiente.

Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados para comprar fertilizantes, abonos, para la preparación de la tierra y el pago de mosos y cultivar  7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Su propósito, es continuar apoyando a su esposo, en todas las actividades productivas y ahorrar para adquirir ganado bovino.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 52 years old.  She has worked from a very young age.  She used to have to wake up very early to prepare meals for her father and siblings for when they went out to work.  She then had to help her mother with household chores.  At 18 years old, Guapalupe married and started working in agriculture with her husband.  From this marriage, Guadalupe has had six children and, with a lot of effort, she was able to provide them only with a primary education.  All six children now have partners and have left home.  Guadalupe receives very little help from her children.  Guadalupe also has an adopted daughter.

Alongside her husband, Guadalupe works in agriculture, sowing corn and jicama on 7000 square metres of land.  Guadalupe and her husband first planted the crops when they first married.  In addition to this work, Guadalupe buys some basic consumer products to resell and make some extra money to help with household costs.  The only child that helps Guadalupe is the adopted daughter. She works in the local town hall.

This loan will be used to buy fertilisers and manure, to prepare the land, and to pay labourers, to work 7000 square metres of land.  Guadalupe's aim is to continue supporting her husband with the crops and saving money in order to buy some cattle.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers and manure, to prepare the land, and to pay labourers, to work 7000 square metres of land.

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
María de 45 años de edad, es casada, madre de 4 hijos; pero solo dos viven con ella de 14 y 19 años de edad. Ella logro sacar primer año de educación básica. Su esposo no vive con ellas, por la situación de pobreza que viven, tuvo que emigrar hacia Estados Unidos, él trabaja en diferentes actividades, lo que le surja  de trabajo (jardinería, ayudante de albañil, etc.)
Con ella viven sus dos hijas menores, una de ella dejo de estudiar para ayudarle en las actividades agrícolas, porqué es poco lo que su padre manda (remesas) no les alcanza para cubrir sus necesidades básicas; la menor (14 años), está estudiando octavo grado. 
La señora,  se ha dedicado siempre al cultivo de granos básicos, sus padres fueron quienes le ensenaron a trabajar en la tierra. Ella hace esta actividad, porque es lo único que tiene como medio para llevar el sustento a su familia. Pero al mismo tiempo, en temporadas se dedica a la crianza de gallinas, para venderlas en navidad, cuando estas tienen un mejor precio. Trabaja casi todos los días en su milpa, porque solo su hija le ayuda a trabajar en esta labor. Su cultivo esta cerca de su casa.
El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas, para el manejo oportuno de su cultivo aprovechando la época de siembra y al final del ciclo productivo, venderá su cosecha, obteniendo los ingresos que necesita para su familia.
Desea tener una fuente de ingresos que le permita sacar los estudios de su hija, y también que le permitan mantener su familia, para que su esposo regrese al país y no ser una familia desintegrada.
texts.en:
Maria, 45, is married and is the mother of 4 children; two live with her ages 14 and 19. She achieved first year of basic education. Her husband doesn't live with them because of their impoverished situation, he had to emigrate to the United States. He works in different activities; whatever work comes up (gardening, bricklayer's assistant, etc...)

Her two smaller daughters live with her. One daughter left her studies to help her mother in farming because her father sends little (remittance) it isn't enough to cover their basic necessities; the youngest daughter, 14, is studying in eighth grade. 

Maria has always worked growing basic grain. Her parents were the ones who taught her to work the land. She does this activity because it's the only means of income that she has to support her family. But at the same time, on off-seasons she raises chickens to sell them at Christmas time when they are better priced. She works almost every day on her cornfield because only her daughter helps her. Her crops are near her house.

The loan that she is requesting is to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and herbicides for the timely management of her crops, taking advantage of planting season and at the end of the productive cycle selling her harvest and obtaining the income that she needs for her family.

She wishes to have a source of income that allows her to provide for her daughter's studies, that allows her to support her family so that her husband can return to their country and that her family not be separated.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and herbicides for the timely management of her crops, taking advantage of planting season.

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es:
María de 52 años de edad. Desde muy pequeña se a dedicado a trabajar, su familia estaba conformada por 10 hermanos; ella  debía despertarse muy temprano para  alistarles los alimentos a sus hermanos, para que llevasen a su trabajo; mientras tanto ella ayudaba a su madre en el hogar y elaboraban ventas que le permitían  ingresar dinero a su familia.

A sus 23 años se acompaño y trabajo con su compañero de vida y procrearon 3 hijos, pero ellos estuvieron poco tiempo juntos, él  la abandono y tuvo que dedicarse a cuidar a sus hijos por su propia cuenta, con mucho esfuerzo trabajando llevando la venta a otras personas que la buscaban para andar de casa en casa, pudo lograr que sus hijos pudiesen estudiar hasta un bachillerato, ademas pudo construir una pequeña vivienda.

María, se dedica a vender de casa en casa, pero la venta no es de ella, es de personas que la buscan  para la distribución en el cantón vendiendo: carnes y pan horneado, tiene que madrugar de acuerdo a la cantidad de productos que le colocan, ya que tiene que terminarlos en la mañana por ser productos perecedero, en ocasiones lo vende en todo el día. Tiene que caminar durante todo el camino que circula un promedio de 5 kilómetros en todo el día. Su hijo menor quien esta con ella, es el que le ayuda y trabaja la agricultura sus otros dos hijos se acompañaron y poco le ayudan.

Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados para comprar 2 puertas para su vivienda, las que tiene no son de material seguro, con ello tendrá una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su hijo, permitiendole a la vez  terminar de construir su pequeña vivienda.
texts.en:
María, 52, has worked since she was very young.  She was one of 10 siblings and had to get up very early to get food ready for her brothers and sisters so they could take it to work.  She also helped her mother in the home and they worked in sales, which allowed them to bring home money to the family.

María got married when she was 23 and worked with her life partner, with whom she had three children.  They weren't together for long, though; he abandoned her and she had to take care of the children on her own.  She worked very hard selling to people who looked for her door-to-door.

María managed for her children to study up to college.  She also was able to build a small house.

María makes a living selling door-to-door.  The business isn't hers, though; it belongs to people who hire her to sell meat and baked bread in the canton.  She has to get up very early, depending on the number of products they give her.  She has to finish selling them in the morning because they're perishable.  Sometimes she sells everything in a day.  She has to walk an average of five kilometers a day on her route.  Her youngest child goes with her to help and also works in agriculture.  Her other two children went with her but didn't help her very much.

The loan will be used to buy two doors for her house because the ones she has aren't safe.  With this she and her son will have a better quality of life.  She'll also be able to finish building her small home.

loans.use: to buy two doors

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly works hard to support her family. Shirly is widowed and has a butcher shop business in the Philippines.

Shirly requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more meat to sell.

Shirly has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Shirly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more meat to sell.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna is 34 years old and married with three children; one of whom is in school.

Elna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like eggs, soap, coffee, soy sauce, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Elna has borrowed and paid back 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and earning an income from raising pigs and chickens.

Elna aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like eggs, soap, coffee, soy sauce,  shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Adelante Cocachacra Group

texts.es: Elizavet tiene 47 años es soltera con dos hijos educando. Hace 21 años se dedica a la producción de frutas como son la chirimoya, palta, manzana. Las frutas que produce las vende a los mercados mayoristas y en sus tiempos libre las vende a sus vecinos. Es de esta manera que ha podido educar a sus hijos. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes y más plantaciones de chirimoya. Su mayor deseo es terminar de construir su vivienda y darles la mejor educación a sus hijos. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Elizavet es la segunda del lado izquierdo viste polo morado.
texts.en:
Elizavet is 47 years old. She is single with two children in school. For 21 years she has been growing fruit such as chirimoyas, avocados, and bananas. She sells the fruit that she produces at the wholesale markets, and in her free time she sells them to her neighbors. It is in this way that she has been able to educate her children. She will invest the loan in the purchase of fertilizers and more plantings of chirimoyas. Her greatest desire is to finish building her house and give the best education to her children.

The group is grateful to the Kiva investors for the loan. Elizavet is the one wearing the purple shirt.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Ricardo Antonio

texts.es:
Ricardo tiene 52 años de edad, es casado y padre de tres hijos a quienes con mucho esfuerzo les dieron el estudio asta primaria;  pero también dedicándose a la agricultura.  Desde muy pequeño en compañía de su padre y sus 6 hermanos trabajaban en las labores agrícolas. A sus 16 años se acompaño y empezó a trabajar por su cuenta en compañía de su esposa, ademas se dedicaba a la crianza de bovinos y especies menores. Dos de sus hijos le ayudan a trabajar la tierra y el mayor quien ya se acompaño trabaja con él; pero en áreas aparte cada uno. El trabajo los realizan cerca de su casa ya que han podido conseguir unas hectáreas de tierra para trabajarlas.

Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados para la compra de insumos agrícolas; abonos, fertilizantes,  y para preparar la tierra para el cultivo de maíz. Con los ahorros que vaya generando, desea adquirir ganado bovino  y procesar la leche para vender lácteos.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 52 years old, married, and father to three children. He worked hard to educate his children up until primary school, but he was also working in agriculture. He has done agricultural work since he was very young, when he worked together with his father and six brothers. At the age of 16 he entered a relationship. Together with his wife, he began working on his own, also raising cows and minor species. 

Two of his sons help him to work the land, and the older, who already has a partner, works with him. But each of them work in different areas. They work near their home, as they have been able to obtain some hectares of land to cultivate. 

The loan money will be used to buy agricultural supplies such as compost and fertilizer, and to prepare the land for growing corn. With the savings he is generating, Ricardo wants to acquire a herd of cows and process milk to sell dairy.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer and to prepare land for growing corn

loans.name: Marina

texts.ru: Марина - разведена. Имеет двоих детей, дочь 18 лет и сына 10 лет. После развода Марине приходилось тажело, т.к. надо было обеспечивать детей самостоятельно. Сейчас у Марины есть свой бизнес. Она продает женскую одежду на рынке. Товар качественный, есть постоянные клиенты. В свободное время дочь помогает матери в бизнесе. Марина просит предоставить ей кредит в размере 5,000 гривен на закупку нового осеннего товара.
texts.en: Marina is divorced.  She has two children - an 18 year-old daughter and a 10 year-old son.  It was difficult for Marina after the divorce because she had to provide for her children alone.  Now Marina has her own business.  She sells women's clothing at a market.  Her merchandise is of good quality and she has regular customers.  Her daughter helps her mother in the business in her free time.  Marina is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 hryvnia to purchase new fall merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase new fall merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an Industrial Dryer.

loans.name: Piedad

texts.es: Piedad, de 35 años de edad, es madre 03 hijos, de 18,15 y 10 años de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Piedad es la ejecución y dirección de obras de construcción. Trabaja junto a su esposo en la implementación de áreas de trabajo, construcción de infraestructura, consultoría de obras y otros servicios relacionado a este rubro. Se inició en esta labor hace 7 años, pero luego de los primero 04 años tuvo que dejarlo por falta de capital y otros motivos personales, ahora lo está retomando con mucho optimismo y mucha fuerza. Tiene en su casa una oficina en donde trabaja con el uso de su computadora en la elaboración de planos o prospectos de las obras que plantea a sus posibles clientes. Afortunadamente ya ha obtenido buenos resultados y en este mes tiene mucho trabajo por realizar. Hasta el momento ha tenido buenas ganancias económicas y eso la deja satisfecha y con ganas de seguir adelante desarrollando su labor. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2500, está muy contenta por contar con el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuota de manera puntual. Con el préstamo solicitado comprará papeles especiales para elaborar planos, plumones de dibujo técnico, tinta para impresión de documentos.
texts.en: Piedad is thirty-five years old, and a mother of 3 children who are 18, 15 and 10 years old, respectively.  She lives with them in her own home.  Piedad carries out and manages construction projects.  She works along side her husband in work area implementation, infrastructure construction, project consulting and other services related to this field. She began this work seven years ago, but after 4 years she had to leave due to lack of funds and other personal reasons.  Now she is starting again with a lot of optimism and strength.  She works from her in-home office using her computer to create plans or pamphlets of projects that she lays out for her clients. Fortunately she has already had good results and this month she has a lot of work.  So far she has had good economic profits and this has left her satisfied and with a desire to continue developing her work.  For this opportunity, she will ask for S/. 2500.  She is very satisfied to count on the financial support that is coming in order to move forward.  Further, she promises to pay her dues on time.  With this solicited loan she will buy special papers to carry out plans, patent drawing felt tip pens and ink for printing documents.

loans.use: to buy special papers to carry out plans, patent drawing felt tip pens and ink for printing documents

loans.name: Josita

texts.en:
Josita is 47 years old, married and has three children in school. 

Josita is in the pig fattening agricultural business in the Philippines. Josita requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds for her pig.

Josita has been pig fattening for four years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Josita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds for her pig

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 50 years old and married with ten children, two of whom are in school.

Letecia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional goods like spices, eggs, soap, sugar, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Letecia has borrowed and paid back 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and earns an income from buying and selling chickens.

Letecia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional goods like spices, eggs, soap, sugar, shampoo,  etc. to sell.

loans.name: Sabougnouma 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe   Sabougnouma 1sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 6 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Loutana, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Ils sont à leur 6 ème  prêt avec SORO YIRIWASO
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs, et  MOUSSA  debout au milieu, sur la photo, 
 compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 210.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Members of the Sabougnouma 1 group are married men who on average are 45 years old with six children, all living in traditional families in Loutana, one of the villages in Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with Soro Yiriwaso.

Moussa grows corn. He is standing in the middle of the photo, and will use the loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and pay for plowing to maintain one hectare of land (2.437 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold in the village and at the market, to a clientele composed mainly of dealers from big cities. He is hoping for a profit of 210,000 CFA francs per growing season.

This profit will allow him to pay off his loan and also help the larger family with daily expenditures.

loans.use: buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Sabougnouma 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe   Sabougnouma 2 sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 6 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Loutana, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Ils sont à leur 6 ème  prêt avec SORO YIRIWASO
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs, et AMIDOU debout au milieu, sur la photo, 
 compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice de 200.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The group members of Sabougnouma 2 are married men who are an average of 45 years old, and who have six children on average. They live in traditional families in Loutana, a village in Sikasso, which is in the third administrative region of Mali. 

They work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to see their business through the rainy season. This is their sixth loan with Soro Yiriwaso. 

They grow corn, and Amidou, pictured in the center of the back row, would like to use his loan to buy farm inputs and seeds, and to pay for plowing for one hectare of land.

They sell their crops in Sikasso after the harvest. Their sell mainly to resellers from big cities. 

He would like to earn an profit of 200,000 FCFA per season. This profit will allow him to pay back his loan and help his large family with their daily expenses.

loans.use: buy farm inputs, seeds, and to pay for plowing.

loans.name: Daisy Len

texts.en:
Daisy Len is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

Daisy Len has been in this business for 24 years. Daisy Len earns more income from buying and selling beauty products.

Daisy Len has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
Modesto de 68 años de edad, es viudo. En su niñez fue regalado a una pareja ajena a su familia directa, ya que sus padres no pudieron criarlo. Luego su familia adoctiva, lo tomaron como hijo, eran de bastante bajo recursos económicos; pero lo importantes es que lo criaron honradamente.

A sus 12 años trabajaba jornaleando y trabajando la milpa, a sus 20 años se caso y procrearon una hija. hoy en día esta acompañada y vive bastante lejos de él. Su esposa hace 6 años fallecido y se quedo solo.

Él continua trabajando, cultiva 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. La persona que le enseño fue su patrón, cuando tenia 12 años ya que desde entonces se dedicado a esta actividad. También, se dedica a la crianza de bovinos y es jornalero en la zona donde vive. Su trabajo lo realiza en el cerro a dos kilómetros de su casa, tiene que madrugar ya que ordeña cierto numero de vacas de un ganadero de la zona. Luego, se va para su milpa donde trabaja en la tierra, más tarde regresar para cuidar los animales que tiene en su casa.

Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados para la compra de insumos agrícolas: abonos, fertilizantes, pago de mosos y para preparar la tierra para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Mas adelantes, desea comprar vacas lecheras para que sean utilizados como ahorro para su vejez.
texts.en:
Modesto, 68 years old, is a widower. As a child he was given away to an unrelated couple because his parents were not able to raise him. His adoptive family treated him as their own son. They had few financial resources, but what was important was that they raised him to be an honorable person.

When he was 12 years old he was working as a day laborer in the corn fields. At the age of 20, he married and had a daughter. Today, she has a partner and lives quite far from him. His wife died six years ago and he is alone. 

Modesto continues working. He cultivates 7,000 sq. meters of corn. The person who showed him how was the boss he had when he was 12 years old because he has engaged in this work since that time. He also raises cows and hires out as a day laborer in the area around his house. He works on a hillside two kilometers from his house. He has to get up at dawn because he milks a certain number of cows owned by a cattle breeder in the area. Afterwards, he goes to his corn fields where he works the soil. Later he returns to take care of the animals he has at home.

Funds from the loan will be used to purchase agricultural supplies, such as compost and fertilizer and to pay lads to help prepare the land to cultivate 7,000 sq. meters of corn. In the future, he wants to buy milk cows so that they can be used to accumulate savings for his old age.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizer,  pay youths and prepare the land to cultivate 7,000 sq. meters of corn.

loans.name: Litchel

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Litchel works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Litchel is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase a fishing net and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

Litchel has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Dios Es Amor” constituida por 08 socios que con el fruto de sus esfuerzos han logrado brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias. Este es el caso de nuestra socia Josefina  casada con 02 hijos independientes. A sus 57 años Josefina ha logrado cumplir con algunos de sus sueños como mejorar su vivienda y mantener su negocio. Comenzó con la venta de juguetes poco a poco pudo implementar su negocio es por ello que actualmente también ofrece útiles escolares, lleva desempeñando en esta actividad hace más de 20 años. Con el afán de seguir mejorando solicitó el crédito la cual comprará juguetes y cuadernos. Su mayor deseo es de aperturar un restaurante, pues así asegura ella tendrá mayores ganancias. El grupo “Dios Es Amor” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Josefina  se encuentra en la parte de adelante es la segunda del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
The Dios Es Amor communal bank is comprised of eight members.  With the fruit of their efforts they have managed to give their families a better quality of life.

This is the case with Josephina, a member.  She is married and has two independent children.  In her 57 years Josefina has managed to fulfill some of her dreams like improving her house and maintaining her business.

She started selling toys.  Little by little she was able to realize her business.  That is why she currently also sells school supplies.  She has been carrying out this business activity for over 20 years.  

With the desire to continue improving, she requested the loan.  She will use the loan to buy toys and notebooks.  Her biggest wish is to open a restaurant.  This way she would be sure to have greater income.

The Dios Es Amor group is grateful to the people who made this loan possible.  Josefina is in the front, and she is the second one on the left.

loans.use: to buy toys and notebooks.

loans.name: Novylinda

texts.en:
Novylinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a internet cafe business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy an additional computer for her internet cafe business.

Novylinda has been in this business for one year and she earns more income from a general store.

Novylinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional computer for her business.

loans.name: Los Lirios Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Los Lirios” está  conformada por 06 mujeres  trabajadoras que cada día buscan mejorar con el único propósito de velar  por el bienestar de sus familias. Este es el caso de  Ana que se  dedica a la venta de pescados, la cual ofrece en un mercado. Gracias a su perseverancia Ana logrado mejorar su vivienda y apoyar a sus hijos.  Posteriormente piensa instalar una boutique. Con el crédito que solicitó lo destinará para la compra de pescados y arreglos de su local donde ofrece sus productos. Ana de 43 años es separada con 03 hijos, 01 de ellos aún dependiente. El grupo “Los Lirios” agradecen el crédito brindado y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Ana  es la segunda del lado izquierdo lleva lentes y viste chompa azul y pantalón negro.
texts.en:
The Los Lirios communal bank is comprised of six hard-working women.  Every day they seek to improve with the sole purpose of watching out for the well-being of their families.

This is the case with Ana.  She sells fish at a market.  Thanks to her perseverance, Ana has managed to improve her house and support her children.  Later, she is planning on installing a boutique 

She will use the requested loan to buy fish and to make repairs to the place where she sells her products.  Ana, age 43, is separated and has three children.  One of them is still dependent.

The Los Lirios group is grateful for the loan that was provided, and they pledge to continue working well.  Ana is the second one on the left side.  She has on glasses and is wearing a blue sweater and black pants.

loans.use: to buy fish and to make repairs to the place where she sells her products.

loans.name: Ingrid Beatriz

texts.es:
Ingrid es una joven de 23 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene 2 hijas. Solo estudio séptimo grado, ya que no tuvo la oportunidad  de continuar sus estudios por dedicarse a los oficios de la casa, tiene un año de trabajar en la crianza de pollos de engorde, trabajo que aprendió por la misma necesidad de subsistencia y la falta de empleos en su país. Para criar sus pollos a construido una galera en el patio de su casa con laminas y madera vieja, pero muy adecuada, con sus bebederos y comederos, todos los días alimenta sus pollos y les provee de agua limpia con su antibiótico y vitaminas, para asegurase que no se le enfermen sus pollos los vende a comerciantes mayoristas en los mercados de la ciudad y otros los llegan a traer hasta su casa. 

para adquirir sus pollitos, viaja en un autobús, el cual pasa por su comunidad, el viaje tarda casi una hora, siempre compra en un  agro servicio, ya que le venden pollitos de calidad y a buen precio. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar 200 pollitos de engorde  y 15 sacos de concentrado para alimentarlos, vitaminas, antibióticos y otros. De esta manera,  conseguirá precios mas bajos, se evitara tantos viajes a la ciudad, ya que son dificultosos y tendrá siempre pollos en existencia para suplir las demandas de sus clientes. 

Al tener su galera siempre llena de pollos,  estará segura de sus ingresos, lo que ayudara a ir creciendo con el negocio y a la subsistencia de su familia.  Sueña con expandir su negocio, para que sus hijas puedan tener estudio y una casa propia.
texts.en:
Ingrid is a young, 23 year old woman. She has a partner and two daughters. She only studied until the seventh grade, since she did not have the opportunity to continue her studies because she dedicated herself to housework. She has spent one year working to raise and fatten chickens, a job she learned because of the need for an income and the lack of jobs in her country. To raise her chickens, she has built a gallery on the patio of her house with  metal sheets and old wood, but it is sufficient with the water and food troughs. She feeds her chickens everyday, and she provides them with clean water with antibiotics and vitamins to ensure that the chickens do not get sick. She sells the chickens to large businessmen in the markets in the city, and for others, she brings the chickens to their houses.

To buy her chicks, she travels by bus, which passes through her neighborhood. The trip takes almost an hour. She always buys from agricultural service centers, since they sell good-quality chicks at a good price.

The loan that she is requested is to buy 200 chicks for fattening and 15 sacks of feed, including pellets, vitamins, antibiotics, and other things. In this way, she will continue to offer low prices; will avoid many trips to the city, since they are difficult; and will always have living chickens to meet the demands of her clients.

Having a gallery always full of chickens will ensure her income, which will help her to continue growing her business and the security of her family. She dreams of expanding her business so that her daughters can have an education and their own home.

loans.use: to buy 200 chicks for fattening and 15 sacks of feed, including pellets, vitamins, antibiotics, and other things

loans.name: Iroda

texts.ru: Ирода трудолюбивая, шустрая, общительная девушка. Ироде 25 лет и она замужем. Она имеет двух очаровательных дочерей. Ирода очень любит проводить время со своими дочурками. Хоть девочки и не ходят в детский садик, Ирода занимается их развитием самостоятельно, она учит их рисовать, лепить из пластелина, а также заучивать стихи. Сама Ирода имеет среднее образование. Муж Ироды работает мастером на станции технического обслуживания. Он и Ирода живут очень дружно, у них большое взаимопонимание и они всегда поддерживают друг друга. Чтобы помогать мужу зарабатывать деньги в дом, Ирода занимается своим малым бизнесом. Она занимается купле-продажей детской одежды и обуви на местном вещевом рынке района. Этот бизнес приносит ей хороший доход, этот доход является основным в семье. Также вместе с мужем они откармливают несколько скот для дальнейшей продажи. Это дело также приносит им дополнительный доход. Но Ирода хочет развивать свой бизнес продажи одежды. Сейчас сезон осенней одежды и школьной формы для детей. Поэтому Ирода хочет пополнить свой ассортимент и расширить бизнес. Она обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на закуп детской школьной одежды. Она очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en:
Iroda is a hardworking, smart and sociable woman.  She is 25 years old, married, and she has two adorable little girls.  Iroda loves spending time with her daughters, and since they do not go to preschool, Iroda raises them by herself, teaches them how to draw, to do play-dough and recite nursery rhymes.  Iroda herself has a secondary education.

Iroda's husband works as a master mechanic at a technical service station.  Iroda and her husband have a very good relationship, they understand each other very well and always support each other.

In order to help her husband, and to bring some money home, Iroda has become involved in her own small business.  She buys and sells children's clothing and shoes at the local clothing market.  Thanks to this business, she makes quite a good income income, which constitutes the family's main source of revenue.

As an additional source of income for the family, Iroda and her husband also fatten a few head of cattle for future resale. 

However, it is her clothing retail business that Iroda currently wants to develop.  With the autumn season approaching, it is now time to sell fall clothing as well as children's school uniforms.  For this reason, Iroda would like to increase her inventory and expand her business.  She has turned to MDO Arvand and requested a loan to buy children's school clothes.  She really hopes to get a positive result and thanks her lenders in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
