As a married parent of eleven children, Chona works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fishing and raising pigs. Chona is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell for her buy-and-sell fruits and vegetables business.

Chona has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Cristo Rey De Nicolas De Pierola Group

texts.es: El grupo” CRISTO REY DE NICOLAS DE PIEROLA” está conformada por 10 socias quienes se sienten contentas por encontrarse pasando el 18 ciclo. Luisa tiene 59 años es casada quien se encarga de la educación de su hijo y nieto  de 14 años. Luisa trabaja como modista hace 30 y a la vez se dedica a tejer a máquina. Años atrás se dedicaba a dar clases de corte y confección y a trabajar en talleres de confección. El préstamo lo invirtió en la compra de telas agujas hilos y accesorios que le faltan. Su mayor deseo es comprar maquinas modernas.  El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Luisa es la persona más alta del grupo viste chompa negra.
texts.en:
The Cristo Rey De Nicolas De Pierola group is comprised of ten members.  They are happy to be in their 18th cycle.

Luisa, age 59, is married.  She is responsible for the education of her son and her 14 year old grandson.  Luisa has worked as a dressmaker for 30 years, and she knits by machine.  Years ago she gave sewing classes and worked at seamstress shops.

She will use the loan to buy fabric, needles, thread, and accessories that she needs.  Her greatest wish is to buy modern machines.

The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan.  Luisa is the tallest person in the group, and she is wearing a black sweater.

loans.use: to buy fabric, needles, thread, and accessories.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 40 years old, single, and works hard to support her parents and her nephews.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling fertilized duck eggs. Angelina is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business and for her food vending business.

Angelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

Daisy has been in this business for 12 years. She earns more income from a general store.

Daisy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Jonelyn

texts.en:
Jonelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell live fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more live fish to sell for her buy-and-sell live fish business.

Jonelyn has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from a general store.

Jonelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more live fish to sell

loans.name: Basam

texts.en:
Basam is a 45-year-old married man. He has two children and they are studying in public schools.

He has worked as a contractor for nine years. He grew up in a poor household, but with the support of his family he was able to study at secondary school. This knowledge has helped him support himself and gain experience in different fields.

Basam is requesting this loan to buy cement and other materials, since this way he can improve his workshop and serve his customers pleasantly, which will improve his living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy cement and other materials for his workshop

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 45 year old married man; he lives with his wife and one child in Tulkarem.

He is buying and selling cattle. He has been involved in this business for three years. Ahmad's business is located in an area favorable for business, and his primary customers are local residents.

He will use this loan to buy animal feeds and other farm inputs. This will help him to increase his profit and give his family better economic conditions.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 26-year-old single man from Gaza city. His father is an employee in a local company. Mohammad is a Master student in the university. He studies Accounting as a major. Mohammad is in his last semester and now he is preparing to write his thesis. 

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to write his thesis and use specific programs for the analysis. 

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study

loans.name: Banco Mujer Las Laboriosas Group

texts.es: Este es el tercer crédito de Doña Gloria y su grupo, está señora tan emprendedora tiene la motivación y la capacidad de identificar las necesidades de su comunidad y organizar los recursos con los que cuenta, transformándolo en una actividad económica que le genera ingresos. Su principal actividad es la siembra de hortalizas, y es una producción completamente orgánica, lo que le da a su producto una mejor calidad. Esto lo ha logrado gracias a los 2 préstamos que ha recibido con Fundación Mujer. El crédito al igual que los anteriores lo va a invertir en la compra de semillas, plantas de otros tipos para reproducirlas, bolsas, recipientes para preparar el abono orgánico, arena especial, un tipo de plástico muy grande especial para cubrir su cosecha y otros insumos para sus cultivos, que vende en su misma comunidad y también a intermediarios que los distribuyen en otras zonas. Su grupo sigue muy sólido junto a ella lo integran 7 socias más que van a invertir en actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en:
This is the third loan for Gloria and her group. Her group remains very close. There are seven other members who also will invest their portion of the loan in agriculture and fishing.

Gloria is an enterprising woman who has the motivation and the capacity to identify the needs of her community. And  organize the resources for those who need them and make them into an economic activity that makes money. Her main activity is growing vegetables, totally organic, which produces a superior quality product. She has achieved this thanks to two previous loans that she got through Fundación Mujer. 

This loan, as with the past loans, will be used to buy seeds, other types of plants to reproduce, bags, containers to prepare the organic fertilizer, special sand, a special type of large sized plastic to cover the plants and other supplies for her crops. Gloria will sell them in her community and also to middlemen who will sell them in other areas.

loans.use: to buy seeds, plants of other kinds, bags, containers and special sand.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru: Нигора молодая, красивая, энергичная и очень жизнерадостная женщина. Нигоре 41 лет. Она замужем и является матерью троих детей. У неё очень дружная семья.  Муж Нигоры работает мастером. Это его основной доход. Работа его сезонная и в летний период работа Усмона удваивается. Дети Нигоры уже взрослые. Сама Нигора более 8 лет занимается розничной торговлей. Нигора и  Усмон с утра уходят на работу и к вечеру уже приходят уставшие, но дети  стараются  во всём помогать, и радуют этим своих родителей. Нигора любит общение и у неё большой круг друзей. Несмотря на свою занятость Нигора старается уделять своё драгоценное время своим близким и друзьям. Эти качества характера поддерживает Нигору в жизнедеятельности. По началу у Нигоры был маленький магазинчик, где она продавала хозяйственные товары, но спустя годы она расширила свой оборот. И на данный момент продаёт мебель. В жаркие летние дни, когда созревают наши вкусные фрукты: спелые арбузы, дыни, виноград разных сортов, персики, начинаются свадебные мероприятия. Летний стол ещё больше придаёт красоту свадебным мероприятиям. И в связи с этим Нигоре надо разнообразить свой товар. Так как подарком в основном для молодожён является мебель. Нигора хочет пополнить ассортимент своего товара, ей необходимо закупить больше разнообразной  и интересной мебели. Для этого ей нужны денежные средства. В связи с этим Нигора обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку мебели. Она надеется на поддержку и выражает свою благодарность Киве и Арванд.
texts.en:
Nigora is a young, attractive, energetic and cheerful woman of 41. She is married and a mother to three children. Their family gets along well. Nigora's husband works as a foreman. It is his primary income but his work is seasonal and in the summertime Usmon's work doubles. Nigora's children are already grown up.

Nigora herself has been working in retail for more than eight years. She and Usmon leave for work in the morning and by evening come home tired, but their children try to help in everything, and their parents are happy in this. Nigora loves to socialize and has a large circle of friends. Despite her employment, Nigora works to devote her precious time to her nearest and dearest. These personality traits support Nigora in her vital activities. 

At first, Nigora had a little shop where she sold household goods, but after a few years she broadened her inventory. At the present moment she sells furniture. On hot summer days, when our tasty fruits ripen - watermelon, cantaloupe, various types of grapes, peaches - the wedding functions begin. And a summer table increases the beauty of a wedding function even more. Due to this, Nigora needs to diversify her goods, as the primary gift for newlyweds is furniture. Nigora wants to fill out her selection of merchandise, and needs to purchase more diverse and interesting furniture. For this she requires monetary resources, due to which she has turned to Arvand requesting a loan to purchase furniture. She hopes for your support and conveys her thanks to Kiva and Arvand.

loans.use: to buy furniture for resale

loans.name: Inoyat

texts.ru: Иноят доброжелательная и позитивная женщина в возрасте 55 лет. Она замужем и имеет  2 детей. Иноят обратилась в Арванд за финансовой поддержкой, ей необходимы деньги для покупки сезонного товара. Иноят вот уже несколько лет занимается собственным бизнесом. От этого бизнеса она получает стабильный хороший доход. Это помогает ей восполнять все нужды своей семьи. Она занимается продажей детской одежды. Её магазин находится в одном из  районов центрального рынка. Скоро начнется учеба во всех школьных учреждениях, и начнется сезон торговли, поэтому сейчас ей необходимо пополнить ассортимент своего товара, закупить детскую школьную одежду, на которую спрос сейчас очень велик. Кроме этого у нее много конкурентов на этом рынке, и ей необходимо иметь лучше товар чем у ближайших продавцов. Для этого Иноят обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку детской школьной одежды для дальнейшей продажи. Она надеется на поддержку от Арванд в развитии её бизнеса и заранее благодарит Арванд за предоставляемую финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Inoyat is a friendly and optimistic 55-year old woman. She is married and the mother of two. Inoyat has turned to Arvand for financial support: she needs funds in order to stock up on seasonal merchandise. Inoyat has been running her own business for several years. She earns a decent stable income, which helps her to provide for her family’s needs. She sells children’s clothing. Her shop is located at one of the arcades of the central market. Soon the school year will begin and sales will go up, which is why she needs to replenish her stocks and buy children's clothing for school, in high demand now. 
In addition, she has many competitors at the market, and needs to offer higher quality goods as compared to the goods of other vendors working in her vicinity. With this goal, Inoyat has applied to Arvand for a loan to buy children’s school clothing for later resale. She hopes for Arvand’s support in developing her business and thanks Arvand in advance for its financial support.

loans.use: to buy  clothing.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her father appears in the photo inside their new home. 

May is a 19-year-old single lady from Qalqilia. She lives with her parents and eight brothers and sisters in a very old house in the city. May's father and her elder brother work as workers in a car station. They get a low wage that barely covers the family needs. May's father would like to improve the family's living conditions by completing his new home.

May took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the costs of completing the family's new home, especially buying tiles. This will help the family to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the costs of completing the family's new home, especially buying tiles

loans.name: Francisca De Jesús

texts.es:
Francisca de 44 años de edad y madre de tres hijos. Estudio hasta cuarto grado. Es casada, pero su esposo  emigro a los Estados Unidos, para  ayudarles, y él trabaja como jornal en cultivos frutales. Vive con ella, solo una nieta que tiene 7 años. Con los ingresos que logra recibir de su esposo, lo invierte en la alimentación de ella y su nieta. Sus hijos ya formaron su propia familia.
Ella a instalado una crianza de pollos de engorde, con experiencia de 7 años  trabajando como negocio propio, ya que siempre se dedico a esta labor desde que se crio con sus abuelos; quienes le ensenaron a trabajar en este rubro.  Ella saca 100 pollos cada 6 semanas (mes y medio), y los vende en el mercado. En este trabajo tiene que estar pendiente todos los días y le ayuda su yerno.
Con el crédito quiere comprar madera, un rollo de maya para el gallinero, laminas para el techo de su local. Lo que busca es ampliar y mejorar las instalaciones (galpón), para tener mejores resultados en su producción y mayor la capacidad de hacer crecer su productividad y así, obtendrá mas utilidades en su  negocio, que a corto plazo significaran mejores ingresos para su familia.
Francisca tiene claro, que si su negocio crece y es rentable, estará mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia y no habrá necesidad de tener que emigrar a otro lugar, sabiendo los peligros que trae este fenómeno.
texts.en:
Francisca is 44 years old and the mother of three children. She studied until the fourth grade. She is married, but her husband emigrated to the United States to help them. He works as a day laborer with fruit crops. She lives with only one granddaughter, who is seven years old. With the income that she manages to receive from her husband, she invests in food for herself and her granddaughter. Her children all have their own families.

Francisca started a business raising and fattening chickens, and has seven years of experience working with her own business. She has always made a living from this work since she was raised by her grandparents, who showed her how to do this work. She takes 100 chickens out every 6 weeks (month and a half) and sells them in the market. She has to be focused on this work every day and is helped by her son-in-law.

With the loan she wants to buy wood, a roll of mesh and sheets for the roof of her chicken coop. She is seeking to expand and improve the facilities (shed) to have better results in her production and a greater capacity to make her productivity grow. She will thus obtain more utility from her business, which will mean better earnings for her family in the short term.

Francisca is clear that if her business grows and is profitable, she will be improving the living conditions for her family and they will not need to emigrate somewhere else, knowing the dangers that come with this phenomenon.

loans.use: to buy wood, a roll of mesh and sheets for the roof of her chicken coop. She is seeking to expand and improve the facilities (shed) to have better results in her production.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas De Patachaj Group

texts.es:
La señora Santa Higinia, de estadoc civil casada, de 50 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 6 hijos y de ellos 2 estan estudiando. Se dedica a la elaboracion de Bordado de Blusas, inició este negocio con un mínimo capital que le concedió su esposo y hasta la fecha lleva 3 años de experiencia; Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a prestar sus servicios como chofer de bus urbano.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un prestamo que lo invertirá para la ampliacion de capital de trabajo, comprará lustrina, telas, forros, etc. Actualmente tiene 6 trabajadores y en el futuro proximo desea tener mas trabajadores para generar fuentes de empleo en su comunodad y tambien poder generar mas ganancias para ayudar a su familia, las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la cofeccion de ropa, actividades agropecuarias y al comercio.
texts.en:
Santa Higinia is 50 years old, married with six children, two of whom are studying. She herself did not have the opportunity to study. She embroiders blouses. She started this business with a small amount of money which her husband gave her and up to now she has three years experience doing this. She can count on the support of her husband who works as a city bus driver.

Santa Higinia organized a group and have requested a loan which she would use to expand her working capital buying lustrina (thread used in the double face brocade design), fabric, lining etc. Right now she has six workers. In the near future she would like to have more workers, creating jobs in her community and generating more income for her family. 

The other members of the group make clothing, farm, fish etc.

loans.use: to buy lustrina (thread used in the double face brocade design) and cloth to embroider.

loans.name: Waqas

texts.en:
Waqas is 22 years old. He is studying in college and lives in Ramallah, Palestine. In June 2011, Waqas opened a small restaurant. He is requesting this youth loan, to make decorations and buy chairs for the restaurant, which will attract customers. 

Waqas hopes that this loan will improve his business and increase his income. His dream is to expand this restaurant and complete his education.

loans.use: to make decorations and buy chairs for his restaurant.

loans.name: Melagrosa

texts.en:
Melagrosa is a merchant from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Melagrosa works hard to assist her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially for the daily food consumption. 

Melagrosa is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soda, soap, beverages, biscuits and snack foods. With this, she will be able to improve her stock to attract more buyers, thus augmenting her sales and profit.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soda, soap, beverages, biscuits and snack foods

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 31 years old and married with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marivic has a business buying and selling rice grain in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Marivic has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Paz Y Bien Group

texts.es: Guadalupe es separada con 04 hijos, 01 de ellos en etapa escolar. Ella pertenece al grupo “Paz Y Bien” conformada por 08 socios comprometidos y responsables que han ido mejorando a través de sus negocios. Guadalupe es una mujer de 58 años, que se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, la cual se desempeña hace más de 05 años. Se siente orgullosa pues gracias a su trabajo ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos. El crédito obtenido lo destinará para la compra de abarrotes y bebidas. Su mayor deseo es crecer en su negocio, pues esto le permite seguir apoyando a su menor hija con sus estudios. El grupo “Paz Y Bien” está agradecido con el crédito brindado. Guadalupe es la segunda del lado derecho y viste cafarena negra y casaca fucsia.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is separated with four children, one of whom is in school. She belongs to the “Paz y Bien” group formed by 8 committed and responsible members who have been improving through their businesses.

Guadalupe is a 58-year-old woman who has made a living by selling products of basic need for more than five years. She feels proud, as thanks to her work she has been able to get her children ahead. The loan obtained will be designated for buying groceries and drinks. Her greatest desire is to grow in her business, as this allows her to keep helping her youngest daughter with her studies.

The “Paz y Bien” group is grateful for the loan provided. Guadalupe is the second woman from the right and is wearing a black turtleneck and fuchsia jacket.

loans.use: to buy groceries and drinks

loans.name: Eriberto Alonso

texts.es:
Don Eriberto cuenta con 59 años de edad, es casado y padre de dos hijos. No asistió a la escuela, porque en su tiempo de niñez no había mucho acceso al estudio en el país y otro motivo por el cual no pudo estudiar fue que su familia era numerosa (8 hermanos), con escasos recursos económicos y tenían que ayudarle a su padre a cultivar para tener el alimento diario. Se encuentra casado y su esposa se dedica a la venta de tamales. Sus hijos ya se apartaron y tienen su propia familia. Su familia actualmente está compuesta por,  su esposa y él. 
 Anteriormente, solo cultivaba granos básicos (maíz, frijol y maicillo), pero desde hace 15 años, además de cultivar;  compra y vende estos granos los días de plaza en el pueblo, buscando obtener un margen de ganancia mayor al de solo cultivar su parcela. También tiene crianza de cerdos. En estas actividades le ayuda su esposa y en ocasiones uno de sus  hijos.  
Necesita comprar 4 silos para guardar el grano y poderlo vender cuando este a mejor precio, ya que no cuenta con estos y le ocasiona pérdidas al almacenarlo sin tener las condiciones en la época lluviosa. Con la adquisición de estos, podrá garantizar el almacenamiento y obtendrá mayor utilidad en su negocio, esto representara,  que podrá  contar con los recursos necesarios,  para los gastos diarios de su familia.
Su sueño, es poder ser parte de una cooperativa que tenga centro de acopio y se dedique a la compra y venta de granos básicos, con la visión de ayudar a los pequeños agricultores del pueblo, con mejores precios por su producción y que sea rentable y sostenible esta organización.
texts.en:
Don Eriberto, age 59, is married and the father of two children. He didn’t attend school, because during his childhood there wasn’t much access to schooling in the country. Another reason he wasn’t able to study was that his family was large (8 siblings), with scant economic resources and they had to help their father with the farming in order to have food to eat daily. Eriberto is married and his spouse works selling tamales. Their children have already moved away and have their own families. His household is currently made up of his wife and him.

Before he raised grew staple crops (corn, beans and sorghum).  For the past 15 years, besides growing, he also buys and sells those staple foods on market days in town, looking to get a better profit margin than he gets by just cultivating his parcel of land. He also has a pig nursery. His wife, and occasionally one of his children, help him in these jobs.

He needs to buy 4 silos to store the staples and be able to sell them when they are at a better price. Without the silos, losses have occurred due to not having proper conditions in the rainy season. With their purchase, he will ensure his stock and will get more benefit from his business.  This will mean that he can count on the necessary means for the daily expenses of his family.

His dream is to be able to be part of a co-op that has a collection center and is dedicated to the purchase and sale of staples. He has a vision of helping the small farmers in town with better prices for their production, and that the organization would be profitable and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy 4 silos for storing harvested crops.

loans.name: Wadhah

texts.en: Wadhah is 30 years old. He is a married man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is the breadwinner for 4 children. He is a soldier earning a low salary, who tries to work hard every day to be able to offer the best to his family. He feels embarrassed when guests come to visit and he does not have furniture for his home. He is requesting a youth loan in order to purchase furniture for his house. His dream is to keep on acquiring the things he lacks; the challenge he faces is fighting any problems that arise.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for his house.

loans.name: Ayda

texts.en:
This is Aydah. Aydah is a 48-year-old married woman from a small village near Jenin City in Palestine. She is the mother of ten children, five sons and five daughters. Two of her sons work as employees in the public sector and earn low incomes, which barely cover the family's needs. 

Aydah is very sick and she urgently needs to undergo a kidney transplant, but does not have enough money. She received a loan from FATEN, Kiva's field partner, which will help her to pay part of the cost of her surgery.

loans.use: to afford to undergo kidney transplant surgery.

loans.name: Sélifatou

texts.fr: Mère d’01 enfant de 19ans, Salifatou est mariée à un chauffeur et est âgée de 35ans. Elle revend des tissus dans une boutique depuis 1998 et sollicite un crédit à WAGES pour renforcer son activité. Comme perspectives d’avenir, madame Salifatou espère avoir d’autres boutiques et assurer la scolarité de son enfant.
texts.en: At 35 years old, Mrs. Salifatou is mother to a 19-year-old and married to a driver. She has been selling fabric in a shop since 1998 and is seeking a loan from WAGES to strengthen her business. In terms of prospects for the future, Mrs. Salifatou hopes to have other shops and to provide for her child's education.

loans.use: To purchase fabric.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin earns a living through his sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in his place. He is a married man and the father of two children ages nine and three. He has been in the business for more than nine years now. 

Edwin needs a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, biscuits, snack foods, animal feed and others. With this, he will be able to improve the diversity of his stock, thus attracting more buyers to his store and augmenting his sales and income.

In the future, Edwin dreams of making his business a success and a sustainable source of his income. Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children and to repay his loan on time.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, biscuits, snack foods, animal feed and others

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
Demetria is a 55-year-old married woman and the mother of five children from San Miguel, Bohol. She earns a living through her retail business selling clothing materials and cosmetics to the people in her place. This is the source of her income. 

Demetria is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like clothing, cosmetics, and others. With this, she will be able to improve her stock, thus allowing her to attract and sell more products to her customers.

In the future, Demetria wants to expand her business so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family, like for daily food consumption and to pay the bills.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like clothing, cosmetics, and others

loans.name: Awfi

texts.en:
Awfi is a 28-year-old married man from a small village near Nablus, a city in Palestine. he is a worker in the public sector, which earns him a low income. For the past year, Awfi and his wife has been working their own land, planting fruits and vegetables (especially tomatoes). They use green houses to ensure that their crops are of very good quality, so they can sell them in Nablus and also to other cities. 

Awfi took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy pesticide, fertilizer, and additional greenhouses. This will improve the couple's business and have a positive impact on their income. 

In this photo, Awfi poses at his farm with some of the tomatoes he and his wife have grown.

loans.use: to buy pesticide, fertilizer, and additional greenhouses.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of five children. She has been in the farming business for more than 10 years now with her husband. Her husband also works as a carpenter. 

Janeth is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for labor costs for the farm. Through this loan, she will be able to improve the productivity of the farm as well as her yield and income. In the future, Janeth has hopes of making her farming venture a success. She also adds that she wants to save money to pay for the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for labor costs for the farm

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 20-year-old single man from Gaza. His father's work is the only source of income for the family. Abdallah is an engineering student in a local university in his third year. He is a very clever student, and he would like to complete his study so he can find a job and help his father support the family.

Abdallah requested a Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study, which includes exercises, homework, and reports that require specific engineering software.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Makarimal Akhlakh Gpe 44 Group

texts.fr: Makarimal Akhlakh est un groupement d’intérêt  économique qui est née depuis 2003.Il regroupe actuellement plus de 3000 membres  composés dans  sa majorité  de femmes et d’hommes  localisées dans les différentes  régions du Sénégal. La création de ce GIE a pour objet de permettre a ses membres d’exercer des activités de production agricoles et halieutiques, de commerce  général import export, de transport, d’industrie, d’artisanat, de bâtiment, d’élevage, d’exploitation minière, de transport pèche, d’exploitation des hydrocarbures, d’art, de culture, d’imprimerie, de services de menuiserie bois, d’actions d’utilité publique, de représentation, de transformation de produits halieutiques, d’agriculture, de vente de pièces détachées, de fabrique de glace, de boulangerie et de prestation  de service. Il est représenté au niveau national par madame Ramatoulaye  qui a signé un protocole d’accord avec UIMCEC dans le cadre de financement de ses membres ce qui leur permettrait d’acquérir des moyens matériels et financiers nécessaires au développement de leurs activités. Par conséquent Makarimal Akhlakh groupe 44 est un sous groupe de crédit  du GIE qui est composé de 10 femmes représentées par la dame Mareme  (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo). Elles habitent la même localité et évolue toutes dans le même secteur d’activité. Mareme  est une femme  mariée qui  s’active depuis plus de 30 ans dans le secteur du commerce,  elle  exerce la vente de tissus et d’autres produits divers. En même temps aussi elle s’adonne a la couture. Les revenus que lui procurent ses activités lui permettent de participer a la gestion de la dépense quotidienne au sein de son foyer, ceci dans le but de soutenir son mari. Elle démarre chaque jour ses activités à 8heures du matin pour la terminer a 16 heures l’après midi. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC ou elle sollicite un crédit dans le but de renforcer son fond de roulement pour mieux développer son activité de commerce.  Elle souhaite acheter des denrées alimentaires (pommes de terre, oignons et poissons séchés qui seront destinés a la vente. Son objectif est d’accroitre les bénéfices qu’elle réalise afin de mieux soutenir sa famille, mais d’épargner davantage d’argent afin de parvenir dans le futur a acquérir de grands magasins de vente de tissus. -Makarimal
texts.en:
Makarimal Akhlakh is an Economic Interest Group that was established in 2003. It currently brings together more than 3,000 members, largely women and men located in various regions of Senegal. The goal of this EIG is to allow its members to carry out agricultural and piscatorial production businesses, general import-export trade, transportation, manufacturing, handicrafts, construction, the raising of livestock, mining, fishing transport, the exploitation of hydrocarbons, art, culture, printing, carpentry services, public interest projects, representation, the processing of fishery products, farming, the sale of spare parts, ice-making, baking, and the delivery of services. The group is represented nationally by Mrs. Ramatoulaye, who signed a memorandum of understanding with UIMCEC as part of the financing of the group's members, which will allow them to acquire the material and financial means necessary to grow their businesses.

Makarimal Akhlakh Gpe 44 Group is a sub-lending group of the EIG, made up of 10 women represented by Mareme (the lady with her hand raised in the photo). They live in the same area and are all advancing in the same business sector.

Mareme is a married woman who has been working in trade for more than 30 years, selling fabric and other various goods. She also devotes herself to fashion. The profits her businesses provide allow her to contribute to the management of daily expenses at home, in support of her husband. She begins work at 8am every day and finishes at 4pm.

Mareme is a member of a local branch of UIMCEC, where she is seeking a loan with the goal of increasing her working capital in order to better grow her business in trade. She wishes to purchase foodstuffs (potatoes, onions, and dried fish, which will be sold). Her aim is to increase her profits in order to better support her family, but [also] to save more money so that in the future she can acquire large shops for the sale of fabric.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Dalia is 27 years old. She lives in Gaza with her husband and her two children at the family house. She sells various kinds of foodstuffs such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, and many others in her grocery store. She opened it more than 5 years ago.

For religious and cultural reasons, the loan officer couldn’t take a picture of Dalia. The one who’s in the picture is Dalia’s husband.

Dalia is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a power generator and refrigerator so she would be able to increase her stock. She is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve her goal and become a successful entrepreneur. Her dream is to build a separate house for her family. 

Dalia is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success in her business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a power generator and refrigerator for her grocery store.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and the mother of seven children. She has been in the farming business with her husband for more than 15 years now. This is their main source of income. Her  husband also works as a carpenter.

Celestina is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of the farm, thus augmenting their yield and income. Celestina wants to expand her farm so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Merita

texts.en:
Merita is a 21-year-old married woman who is living in Kosovo with her husband and two children ages three months and two years old. To support the family, her husband works as a taxi driver in his area, while she is working on some land as is tradition in her family, planting and growing corn and grain. 
 
She always had to pay others to work on her land in order to help harvest the crops and therefore is requesting a loan to purchase an agricultural machine. With the help of this loan she will reduce the costs of cultivating and harvesting her crops as she won’t need additional people to help her. She is hoping in the future to have a better life and secure a better life for her children. She appreciates this support and wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase an agricultural machine

loans.name: Hadil Group

texts.en: This group is called Hadil and consists of five ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. Jamila is 27 years old. She is a hardworking person who has gone through many adversities in her life. For this reason, she has always had a great strength that has allowed her to get ahead. She is a seamstress. Her business provides her with a source of household income and support. She lives in a small house where she acquires home improvements. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER to purchase a television to use in her house.

loans.use: to purchase a television to use in her house.

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es:
Julio, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo crédito porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar en el cultivo de maíz; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar los insumos agrícolas, tales como: semilla, abono, fertilizantes, insecticidas, entre otros.  
Comenta el Sr. Julio que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus inventarios y obtuvo mejores ingresos. Las condiciones económicas se han optimizado y las circunstancias familiares se mantienen igual.
texts.en:
Julio needs to get another loan because he needs more working capital to continue growing corn.  This investment will help him buy agricultural inputs such as seeds, soil amendments, fertilizer, insecticide, and others.

Julio says the previous loan helped him increase his inventory and earn better income.  His economic situation has improved and his family circumstances are stable.

loans.use: to buy seeds, soil amendments, fertilizer, insecticide, and other supplies

loans.name: Shemsi

texts.en:
Shemsi is a 31-year-old, single male. He is living with his entire family in his parents' house in a small village in the mountains, about 7 km from the city. In order to earn a living, he works together with his brother and his father in a private company as a construction worker. Also, based on family tradition, Shemsi works in agriculture, keeping a cow to reduce the cost for milk and milk products. 

Shemsi has recently sold the cow that he had for several years when the family needed additional income. Now, in order for Shemsi to increase his income for his family again, he is asking for a loan to buy a new cow. With this cow, he is planning to reduce the milk and milk-product costs for his family. Shemsi hopes that he will benefit in the future to improve his family's living conditions, and his real goal is to have a better future. Shemsi wants to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a cow to reduce the milk and milk-product costs for his family.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra, vive con su madre de 65 años de edad, sus hijas de 10 y 13 años de edad. Ella, se dedica a la venta de productos de comida, tales como: tamales, también compra y venta de cerdos, dicha actividad la realiza todos los días. 
El préstamo que requiere le servirá para comprar cerdos, maíz, condimentos, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara al fortalecimiento de su negocio y para obtener mayores ingresos.
Su sueño es que sus hijas sigan estudiando hasta culminar el bachillerato y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra lives with her mother, 65, and her daughters, 10 and 13.  She makes a living selling food products such as tamales.  She also buys and sells pigs.  She does this work every day.

The loan Sandra needs will help her buy pigs, corn, condiments, and other things.  This investment will help her strengthen her business and earn more income.

Her dream is for her daughters to continue studying until they finish their degrees and to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs, corn, condiments, and other things

loans.name: Benigna

texts.en:
Benigna is applying for a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is married and she has four children. She is 30 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house, and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as soft drinks (Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko), hard drinks (beer), noodles, fish, soap, oil, sugar, coffee and water. 

She is making good money from selling, and she wants to apply for bigger loans in the future.
 
Benigna is living in a town nearby the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks (Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko), hard drinks (beer), noodles, fish, soap, oil, sugar, coffee and water.

loans.name: Vesna

texts.en:
Vesna is a married woman and a mother of three children between the ages of 8 and 11 years old, living together in a minority community of Kosovo. She and her husband are the owners of a local food shop, and they have been in this business for four years now, which serves as their main source of income. 

At the beginning, they started with a very small shop and have since increased the size and products they supply. She really enjoys what she does, and she has a lot of customers in her area. 

Vesna is requesting a loan in order to buy various foods and other products for her shop. She is very happy for the financial support that KosInvest gives her, because this way she is certain of making progress in her work. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, she wants to thank all lenders!

loans.use: To buy various foods and other products for her shop.

loans.name: Alda

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Alda to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like short dresses, shorts, long pants and short-sleeve shirts. 

She is generating a good income from selling. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy short dresses, shorts, long pants and short-sleeve shirts.

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.en:
Eduarda is 31 years old, and she is now applying for a loan of $1,500 to improve her business. She is married and she has five children. She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $70. She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy some stock to keep in her store such as milk, noodles, sugar, salt, coffee, sugar, eggs, books, fish, body lotion, soft drinks and beer. She is a very hardworking woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 12 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future. She is happy with this loan because it will be offered for the poor people in the future.

loans.use: To buy milk, noodles, sugar, salt, coffee, sugar, eggs, books and fish.

loans.name: Silvio Euclides

texts.es: Silvio Euclides de treinta y ocho años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos uno de 18 años, uno de nueve y uno de cuatro; Él se dedica a la venta de artesanías, de barro, petate, arcilla entre otros además vende ricos sorbetes, tiene muchos años en su labor y ha ganado mucha experiencia en el comercio que le ha permitido mantenerse en el negocio, ya tiene clientela fija que lo prefieren por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios además del servicio inigualable siempre a la orden del cliente, Silvio es responsable y muy luchador siempre esta buscando las mejores alternativas que le permitan salir adelante;  es un hombre dedicado a su trabajo y a toda su familia porque quiere ofrecerles una vida digna, necesita mejorar la vivienda poner balcones a las ventanas y puertas para mayor seguridad de sus hijos, pero Silvio no cuenta con capital que lo respalde por eso se decidió a solicitarle a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar las defensas para las ventanas y comprar las puertas. Silvio Euclides tiene buenas referencias de pago y esta feliz con la ayuda, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda en el periodo establecido.
texts.en:
Silvio Euclides, 38, lives with his life partner and his three children, ages 18, 9, and 4.  He makes a living selling handicrafts of clay and palm leaves.  He also sells delicious sorbets.

Silvio has done this job for many years and gained a lot of experience in commerce, which has allowed him to support himself in the business.  He has steady customers who prefer him because of the quality of his products and the good prices as well as his incomparable service; he's always ready to help the customers.

Silvio's responsible and very perseverant.  He's always looking for the best alternatives so he can get ahead.  He's dedicated to his job and to his entire family, because he wants to give them a decent life.

Silvio needs to improve his house with bars on the windows and doors for his children's security.  Silvio doesn't have the capital to support this, though, so he decided to ask FUSAI for a loan to buy the doors and the bars for the windows.

Silvio Euclides has a good payment record and is happy to have the help.  He's certain he'll be able to pay back the debt by the established deadline.

loans.use: to buy doors and security bars

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана торгует женской спотривной одеждой. Благодаря предыдущему КИВА кредиту Светлана расширила ассортимент товара и сделала хорошие продажи. Это помогло ей достроить бутик и теперь у нее отличные условия для торговли.

Светлана просит предоставить ей еще один кредит на закупку одежды. Кредит поможет ей расширить ассортимент осенней одежды и предложить своим покупателям что-нибудь новенькое. Она собирается ехать на оптовый рынок и просит предоставить ей сумму в размере 23,000 гривен.
texts.en:
Svetlana sells women sports clothing. Thanks to the previous Kiva loan Svetlana expanded the assortment of inventory and made good sales. This helped her finish building a boutique and now she has perfect conditions for business.

Svetlana is asking for another loan to buy clothing. This loan will help her expand the assortment of her autumn clothing and offer her customers something new. She plans to travel to the wholesale market and is asking for a loan in the amount of 23,000 hryvnia.

loans.use: to increase assortment of inventory for the upcoming autumn season.

loans.name: Zamona

texts.ru:
Замона предприимчивая женщина в возрасте 25 лет. Она замужем и имеет двоих детей. У Замоны среднее техническое образование. Она по специальности педагог, но работала в другой области. Муж Замоны работает в милиции. Сейчас Замона собирается открыть авиакассу и заняться продажей авиабилетов. Она уже арендовала помещение, приобрела компьютер и его комплектующие. Теперь осталось купить столы и стулья и оформить помещение для того чтобы открыть авиакассу. Для этого она просит кредит. 
Замона старается ради детей. Она хочет, чтобы ее дети учились в лучшей школе и получили хорошее образование, которое в будущем будет фундаментом для учебы в высшем учебном заведении.
texts.en:
Zamona is a entrepreneurial woman in the age of 25. She is married and has two children. Zamona has secondary technical education. She is a teacher by profession, but has worked in a different field. Zamona's husband works in the police. Right now Zamona plans to open an airline tickets desk and sell airline tickets. She has already rented out a space, bought a computer and its peripherals. Now she still needs to buy tables and chairs and furnish the space to open the sales desk for business. She needs a loan for this purpose.

Zamona tries for her children. She wants for her children to go to the best school and get a good education which will be the base for their education in a higher learning institute in the future.

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs to furnish the office for opening of an airline tickets desk.

loans.name: Zuurakan

texts.ru: Зууракан 55 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Зууракан - высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Зууракан занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Зууракан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 3 теленка, 30 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 1,44 ГА, на которой ежегодно выращивает клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Зууракан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят. Доходы от кредита Зууракан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Zuurakan is 55 years old, she is married and is raising five children together with her husband. Zuurakan has higher education and as a source of main income for her family she does animal husbandry and field crop cultivation which she started twenty years ago with the purchase of cattle for an amount of 10,000 KGS. Because of her hard work Zuurakan now has three milk cows, three calves, thirty sheep in her business as well as a plot of land in the size of 1.44 hectares where she grows clover annually. Her monthly income is 20,000 som. With the goal to further grow her business Zuurakan has come to the Microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 135,000 KGS to buy calves. Zuurakan plans to invest the income from the loan into further increase of the headcount of her livestock.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: A $600 loan is being offered to Paulina to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, fish, water, milk, beer, oil and biscuits. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Paulina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, fish, water, milk, beer and oil to sell

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is applying for a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 33 years old and married. She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as short dresses, shorts, long pants, sleeves, and shoes. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. 

Diana is living in a town near the school. Her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

loans.use: To buy dresses, shorts, long pants, shoes and other clothing items

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as oils, salt, sugar, coffee, eggs, water, milk, pencils, books and fish. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200.00. Francisca is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy oils, salt, sugar, coffee, eggs, water, milk, pencils, books and fish to sell

loans.name: Rogai

texts.en: Rogai is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is a widow who is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as soft drinks, hard drinks, noodles, sugar, coffee, salt, fish, slippers, water, books and cigarettes. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, hard drinks, noodles, sugar, coffee, salt, fish, slippers, water and books to sell

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en: A $1,000 loan is being offered to Fernanda to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store like noodles, oils, coffee, sugar, salt, slippers, water and fish. She is generating a good income from selling. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy noodles, oils, coffee, sugar, salt, slippers, water and fish to sell

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 37ans, madame Adjowa est revendeuse de friperie dans un marche de la vile de Lomé. Elle fait sa première demande pour acheter des balles de friperies. Elle  souhaite développer son activité en ouvrant une boutique  et assurer une meilleure éducation à ses enfants. (Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants). Adjowa a une ancienneté de 04ans.
texts.en:
A young 37-year-old woman, Mrs. Adjowa is a retailer of used clothing in one of Lome's markets. She is requesting her first loan to buy bales of used clothing.

She would like to expand her business by opening a shop and provide better education for her children (she is married and the mother of two children).

Adjowa has four years' seniority (with WAGES).

loans.use: buy second-hand clothes

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Ama âgée de 37ans vit avec son enfant de 15ans scolarisé à Lomé. Pour subvenir aux besoins de ce dernier vue qu’elle a en charge, elle a démarré la vente des produits d’alimentation générale dans une boutique en 2008. Elle sollicite sa première demande de WAGES pour renforcer son activité. Le profit lui permettra d’avoir d’autres activités et prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en: Ama is 37 years old and lives with her son, who is 15 years old and goes to school in Lome. To support their needs, in 2008, Ama started selling general food products in a shop. She is asking for her first loan with WAGES in order to increase her business. Earnings will allow her to have other business activities and to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy general food products

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr: Restauratrice de profession, madame Amivi âgée de 38ans est mariée à un pasteur et maman de 03 enfants. Deux sont scolarisés. Elle a démarré son activité en 2012 dans une boutique. Elle revend du fufu et de la pate. Manquant de matières premières (igname, mais et condiments), elle fait sa première demande à WAGES pour acheter les matières. Elle espère ouvrir une autre boutique et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Amivi is 38 years old, married to a shepherd, and a mother of three children. Two of her children go to school. 

Amivi started a restaurant business in 2012. She resells fufu [a yam based dough] and corn mash. Because she is in need of raw ingredients (yams, corn, condiments), Amivi has asked for her first loan with WAGES. 

She hopes to open another restaurant and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy yams and condiments

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Pour développer son activité, Afi sollicite un premier prêt à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises. Elle revend des pagnes et espère avec le profit développer son activité et fonder plus tard une famille. Elle a 31ans et a démarré en 2011.
texts.en:
To develop her business, Afi is asking for her first loan with WAGES in order to buy merchandise. She is 31 years old and started her business in 2011.

She resells pagnes [colorful fabric] and hopes to expand her business and start a family.

loans.use: to buy pagnes [colorful fabric]

loans.name: Ameyovi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits de détails (cirage, brosse, javel, biscuits…) au marché depuis 2005, Ameyovi sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises. Le profit l’aidera à contribuer au besoin de la famille et agrandir son activité. Âgée de 37ans, Ameyovi est  mariée à un enseignant et mère d’01 enfant.
texts.en:
Ameyovi is 37 years old, married to a teacher, and a mother of one child.

A retailer of various goods (wax, brushes, bleach, cookies...) in a market since 2005, Ameyovi is asking for her first loan with WAGES to buy more merchandise. 

Earnings will help her support the needs of her family and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy retail products

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo agée de 57ans est mariée à un ingénieur. Elle a un enfant de 18ans qui est scolarisé. Pour contribuer aux besoins de la famille, Adjo revend des pots de fleurs, des draps et des perles à domicile. Elle espère agrandir son activité et accroitre le niveau de vie de la famille. Elle a une ancienneté de 13ans.
texts.en:
Adjo is 57 years old and married to an engineer. She has one child, who is 18 years old and has been to school. 

To help support the needs of her family, Adjo resells flower pots, sheets, and beads from her home. She has 13 years experience.

She hopes to expand her business and increase her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy flower pots and sheets

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is applying for a loan of $ 1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin (TRM). She is 30 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as soft drink, hard drink, salt, sugar, coffee, milk, slippers, water and biscuits. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. 
Elsa is living in a town nearby a school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students. She is happy with this loan because it is offered for poor people to improve their living condition for the future.

loans.use: To buy soft drink, hard drink, salt, sugar, coffee, milk, slippers and water

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Juana to improve her business. She is married and she has two children. Juana has a secondhand store where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as shirts, shorts, pants, long sleeve and short sleeve. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002.
Juana feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Juana independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future. There are animals Juana would like, such as goats, buffalo, pigs, and she is very happy because her husband is a farmer so she can help him to run his life.

loans.use: to buy shirts, shorts, pants, long sleeve and short sleeve.

loans.name: Odenciana

texts.en: Odenciana is 29 years old, married, and she has three children. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan and she is now applying for her second loan of $1,000. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as oils, sugar, coffee, salt, eggs, noodles, soft drinks, hard drinks, body lotion and biscuits. She is happy Tuba Rai Metin (TRM) offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy oils, sugar, coffee, salt, eggs and noodles

loans.name: Easter Group

texts.en:
Easter is a group of five Filipino women who came to Lebanon to work as housekeepers because of the burden they suffered from in their hometown. Emelita is the featured borrower of Easter Group. Because they have been close friends since they arrived in Lebanon, she and her group members got together to apply for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua.

Emelita is a 44-year-old divorced mother of two who works as a housekeeper to provide her beloved children with a healthy living and education. Her portion of the loan will be sent to her children in the Philippines to cover most of their increasing needs. Emelita is the first lady standing at the right. Antonia is the one wearing yellow, Donnalyn is in the middle, Florence is the second from the left, and Maricel is the first from the left.

loans.use: To send money to her children in the Philippines to cover their needs

loans.name: Kanini

texts.en:
Kanini, a 47 year old married mother of two in Thika, is a mixed-crop farmer. She earns a monthly income of KES 7,000, which she uses to support her family. 

This marks her second loan term with KADET after repaying her previous loan successfully. With the new loan, Kanini will be able to purchase one-day-old chicks and chicken feeds. 

The additional income she hopes to earn will allow her improve the standard of living for her family. In the future, Kanini would like to further expand into livestock farming. She hopes to save money to expand her farmland.

loans.use: To purchase day-old chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 41-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Helen has a retail rice business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Helen has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Zahrat Al-Jabl Group

texts.en:
Zahrat Al-Jabl is a group of four women. They are from Sana`a, Yemen, and they work together to help one another. They work hard every day to improve their families’ quality of life. Jamila is the leader of the group. She is 45 years old, married, and has three children. 

For three years, Jamila has been embroidering cloth and selling it, which has enabled her to develop a significant customer base. She says that she always has many orders from her customers, especially because she offers good quality in her embroidery work and it is not very expensive. She is turning to AMB to request a youth loan of 40,000 YER in order to fulfill existing orders for her customers. She would like to purchase fabrics, needles, and other items. In the future, Jamila would like to achieve her potential by opening an embroidery shop where she can distribute her goods to the market.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, needles, and other items.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 48 years old. She is married to Wilson, and they are blessed with four children: 27-year-old twins, an 18-year-old, and a 13-year old. She sells groceries, a business she ventured into 13 years ago, and she earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

Margaret wants to purchase cereals, fruits, and vegetables. She has requested her eighth loan, in the amount of KES 70,000. The profit from her business will aid her in purchasing land and building rental houses for additional income. 

Margaret dreams of owning a personal vehicle in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase cereals, fruits, and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 51 years old and married with four children. Letecia runs a general store in the Philippines, and she works hard to provide for her family. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, such as coffee, shampoo, cooking oil, noodles, eggs and other goods.

Letecia has borrowed and repaid 6 previous loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns additional income from dressmaking.

Letecia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family; she is separated, and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Marilyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods like cereals, milk, coffee, soft drinks, etc. to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for seven years.

Marilyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods like cereals, milk, coffee, soft drinks, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rutooma Tweyombekye Group

texts.en:
Midred is a married woman with three children; she operates a drug shop in the Rutooma trading centre along Mbarara – Ibanda Road. She had been bowed down with rent and now is building in the trading centre so that she can cut some of the business costs and increase her income. She therefore needs the loan to complete her building in the same trading centre.

She requested loan of ugx.750,000= to help her finish, and also will use a part of it to pay school fees, because her husband, who is a teacher, earns little and can’t afford to run the family and pay school fees for the kids.

Her major challenge is the increase in prices of building materials, and yet  even the business itself can’t afford to maintain the whole needs of the family.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 33 years old. He operates a carpentry workshop in Mpeketoni, Lamu town, and has been in the business for the last three years. He earns a monthly profit of about 9,000 KES. Joseph was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and he is applying for his second loan of 20,000 KES. 

He intends to use the loan to purchase additional wood material needed for his business. He will save the anticipated profit and help pay school fees for his niece and nephew as well as to continue investing in his business. In the future, Joseph hopes to expand his workshop so as to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase additional wood material for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Pascuela

texts.en:
Pascuela is applying for a loan of $800 to improve her business. She is running a service in her house of repairing computers. She is making a good income from her service and she wants to buy more needed items with the loan. 

She is living in a town near the main road, so many people come to her to repair their computers, and she is open every day. She opened her business two years ago with her own working capital of $50. She is happy with this loan because it offers her the chance to improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy paper, ink, computer equipment, a computer desk, chair, and computer repair items.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marissa is 42 years old and has two children who are in school. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for 15 years. 

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell. Marissa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ruth Bina

texts.en: Ruth Bina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell frozen foods business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 8 years now. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of frozen foods to sell. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Rosita to improve her business. She is married and she has one child. Her husband is a farmer. Rosita has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day.  With the loan she will buy some additional supplies such as soft drinks, hard drinks, cigarettes, oils, coffee, sugar, milk, fish, biscuits, soap and slippers.

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels very comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Rosita independent so she can be responsible for herself as well as helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, hard drinks, cigarettes, coffee, oils, sugar, milk, fish, soap, biscuits and slippers.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a direct selling business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy more avon and personal collection products to sell to her customers.

She has been in this business for 10 years, and earns more income from buying and selling dry goods. Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en: Victorina is 61 years old and widowed with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Victorina has a vehicle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her vehicle. She has been in this business for 7 years and would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her vehicle.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is 30 years of age, married to Silvester, and blessed with two children ages 10 and 2. She runs a retail business she started nine years ago and earns a monthly income of about KES 85,000. 

She wants to restock her business and has requested a seventh loan of KES 100,000 to purchase cooking oil, different juice flavors, packs of rice and sugar. The profit from her business will help her to purchase a piece of land. Peninah's dream is to one day own a vehicle and rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, juices, packs of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Masoud

texts.en:
Masoud is 28 years old, married, and a father of one child. For the past two years, he has earned a living by offering point-to-point transport services in Malindi town, from which he earns a monthly profit of about KES 5,000. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for his first loan, in the amount of KES 20,000. 

He is going to use the loan to service and repair his motorbike as well as to purchase additional spare parts. He will use the profits to pay school fees for his child as well as invest back into his business operations. His goal for the future is to continue growing his business so that he would improve his family's financial stability.

loans.use: To repair and service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetables and spices vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years now. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables and spices to sell in her food stall. In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and spices to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married businessman whose wife earns additional income for the family by growing and selling vegetables. John has seven children who are currently studying. His main business is buying sheep and selling them at a profit. This has been his business for the last four years. He repaid his previous loan successfully and has asked for another loan to expand his current business. With the accumulated profits he can pay school fees and manage his family well.

loans.use: to buy rams and sheep to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is applying for a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is married and she has three children. This is her first loan.

She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as cigarettes, sugar, coffee, salt, water biscuits, oil, sugar and slippers.

Rosita opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $200. She is earning a good income and she will use the income to support her family and improve their living conditions. She is happy with this loan because it is offered to the poor people and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, sugar, coffee, salt and water

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Virgilia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store.  Virgilia is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, rice, spices, vegetables, etc., for her food vending business.

Virgilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, rice, spices, vegetables, etc., for her business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 21-year-old single man who has been working in his convenience store since October 2011. Ali is well-known in his region for his good reputation and hard work.

Ali is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to install a glass display door in his shop. He is facing strong competition, so he has to set special offers and sell a very good quality of products in order to attract new customers and meet his existing customers' needs.

Ali is working hard to keep his store number one, and he hopes to expand it into a wide supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To install a glass display door in his shop

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is 25 years old. He is single and supports two people, who are mainly his younger siblings. He runs a motorcycle transport business also known as a "boda boda". He has been in this business for the last four years and from this business he gets an average monthly profit of 12,000 KES.

Timothy has borrowed a loan of 60,000 KES which he will use to purchase a new motorcycle to expand his business. With the anticipated profits, he will use them to expand his business as well as pay school fees for his siblings.

Timothy's dream is to expand his business into a car hire or taxi service company. With this, he will able to meet his family's financial needs more consistently.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Mtende

texts.en:
Mtende is 29 years old, married and a father of two children. For the past two years, he has earned a living by offering point-to-point transport services in Malindi town, from which he earns a monthly profit of 10,000 KES. 

Mtende was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for his first loan of 20,000 KES. He is going to use the loan to service and repair his motorbike as well as purchase additional spare parts. He will use the profits to pay school fees for his children as well as invest back into his business operations. 

Mtende's goal for the future is to continue growing his businesses so as to improve his family's financial stability.

loans.use: to repair and service his motorcycle

loans.name: Ma. Joyce

texts.en:
Ma. Joyce works hard to support her family. She is married and has had a food vending business in the Philippines for the past 12 years.

Ma. Joyce has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like hotdogs, meat, and chicken for her food production business.

In the future, Ma. Joyce would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 40 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Maribeth works very hard to provide for her family.

Maribeth runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years, selling a variety of items such as detergent, soap, canned goods, sugar, milk, and snack foods. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

In the future, Maribeth would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed, 19 years old, lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has a grocery store. He is well known and has many customers. He is a hardworking and very honorable man, always committed to getting ahead. He was helped to establish his business by his brother. He likes to stay ahead of the competition.

He wants to see his business grow and be an absolute success. It is for this reason that he has decided to request a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy soft drinks and canned food for his business. He knows that in this way he will be able to provide his household with a better economic situation. He hopes to increase his profit to open another shop.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and canned food for his business

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Teodoro es habitante de la bella ciudad de Estelí reconocida como el diamante de las Segovia ubicada en la parte norte de Nicaragua. Estado civil es casado tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Este varón se caracteriza por ser una persona de buenos valores morales entregado a su familia.

Es su tercer crédito con CEPRODEL y manifiesta que han sido de gran impacto en su familia ya que de esta manera ha mejorado su vivienda.
Actualmente es trabajador de una empresa de servicio de acueducto y alcantarillado desempeñándose como fontanero desde hace nueve años.

Con este monto financiado lo va destinar para compra de materiales de construcción tales como zinc y perlines ya que va realizar mejora en el techo de su vivienda.
Teodoro se manifiesta agradecido con kiva por el apoyo brindado ya que va ser posible mejorar su vivienda y dar mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
