También, posee un arado y bueyes, con los cuales gana un poco de dinero trabajándoles a otros agricultores de la zona. Su milpa está bastante cerca de su casa, trabaja todos los días y le ayudan todos sus hijos en las labores agrícolas.

El dinero lo necesita para preparar el terreno donde sembrara y para comprar fertilizantes, herbicidas y pesticidas para el manejo del cultivo, quiere sembrar 21,000  metros cuadrados de ajonjolí. Con esta inversión contara con la oportunidad de establecer este cultivo (ajonjolí) que no es muy común en la zona; pero que tiene gran demanda y por ello mejor precio que el maíz o frijol, que son de los mas cultivados y están con precios bien bajos en el mercado. Tendrá mejores ingresos para el sustento de su numerosa familia.

Don Juan, desea ayudar a sus hijos que puedan seguir estudiando y que puedan  ser profesionales en algún área, para que no tengan que estar siempre trabajando en la tierra, que es tan desgastante y muy mal remunerado.
texts.en:
Juan is a 70-year-old man. He studied through the sixth grade of primary school. He has a partner, and she takes care of the household duties and also raises pigs and chickens. Of the 10 children he has, 6 live with him; of these, two are students, two finished high school, and two were not able to study. The 4 that are no longer with him formed their own households.

He devotes himself totally to farming. He grows corn and beans. Nevertheless, his forte is the cultivation of sesame. He has worked in farming since he was very young, learning this work thanks to his grandmother, since he grew up with her. He also has a plow and oxen, with which he earns a little money working for other farmers in the area. His land is quite close to his house. He works every day and all of his children help him with the farm work.

He needs the money to prepare the land where he will plant and to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and pesticide to manage the crop. He wants to plant 21,000 square meters of sesame. With this investment he will have the opportunity to establish this crop (sesame). It is not very common in the area, but it is in great demand, and thus gets a better price than corn or beans, which are some of the most widely-grown crops and which have very low prices in the market. He will earn a better income to sustain his large family.

Juan wants to help his children so that they can continue studying and can be professionals in some area, so that they will not have to always be working the land, which is so exhausting and very poorly paid.

loans.use: to prepare the land where he will plant and to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and pesticide to manage the crop. He wants to plant 21,000 square meters of sesame.

loans.name: Jesús Roberto

texts.es:
Don Jesús cuenta con 43 años de edad, estudio séptimo grado de educación básica. Esta acompañado, su señora se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y crianza de gallinas ponedoras.
 Actualmente viven con ellos 2 hijos  de los cuales solo la  menor está estudiando y el otro hijo le ayuda en las actividades agrícolas. Los otros dos hijos ya tienen su propia familia, son independientes.
Desde hace 24 años realiza las labores agrícolas.  Actualmente, pertenece a una cooperativa que trabaja con el Ministerio de Agricultura, a la cual le venden su producción; pero su producción se maneja distinta al cultivo convencional de maíz, ya que su producción es para obtener semilla certificada. Su hijo le ayuda a cultivar.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar fertilizantes, herbicidas, pesticidas, pago de mano de obra , para darle el manejo adecuado a sus 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz que tiene sembradas; para la obtención de semilla certificada. Con el dinero podrá aprovechar, la oportunidad que le da la cooperativa de comprarle su producción que con anterioridad ha pactado. Y tener mejores ingresos a diferencia de cultivar  como lo hacen comúnmente. Su producción tiene valor agregado, su calidad.
Don Jesús desea adquirir con sus ganancias una achicadora (motor), que le permita cultivar en verano, con sistema de riego y aprovechar  el hecho de ser socio de dicha cooperativa que le compra su producción a mejor precio que en el mercado informal. Así, podrá apoyar a su hija que pueda estudiar y convertirse en profesional y sea más fácil la forma de ganarse la vida en el futuro.
texts.en:
Jesús, age 43, has a seventh grade education.  He lives with his wife, who does the household chores and raises laying hens.  Two of their children currently live with them.  Only the younger one is in school, and the other one helps Jesús with the farming activities.  Their two other children have their own families and are independent.

He has been farming for 24 years.  He currently belongs to a cooperative that works with the Agricultural Ministry.  He sells them his production.  However, his production is managed differently than the conventional corn crop.  His production is to get certified seed.  His son helps him work. 

He will use the loan to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides.  He will also pay for labor in order to give adequate maintenance to his 14,000 square meters of corn, which he has planted in order to get certified seed.

With the money he will be able to take advantage of the opportunity that the cooperative is giving him to buy his production as previously agreed upon.  It is an opportunity to have better income than cultivating as they commonly do.  His production has added value, its quality.

Jesús wishes to use his earnings to buy a water pump (motor) that will allow him to cultivate in the summer with a watering system.  He will take advantage of being a member of the cooperative that buys his production at a better price than on the informal market.  This way he will be able to support his daughter, who will be able to go to school and become a professional.  It will be an easier way of earning a living in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan is 27 years old and lives in the village of Davit Bek, which is in Syunik region. Vardan is married and has two daughters. 

Since Vardan is back from the army, he has been engaged in farming and agriculture. He breeds at his farm six cows and twenty chickens. He also cultivates tomatoes, cucumbers and greens. His wife is unemployed, and she helps her husband with farming and agricultural activities. She sells their farm and agricultural products at their local wholesale markets. 

Vardan wants to enlarge his farm cattle, and he is asking for a loan of 600,000 Armenian drams to buy several pigs for his farm.

loans.use: to buy several pigs for his farm.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Twenty-year-old Beatrice lives in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County. The county is rich in natural resources, and living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia. Nimba is the second most-populated county in Liberia.

Beatrice is a 10th grade dropout, and she has lived all her life in Sanniquille.  She and her boyfriend live together. Her boyfriend is a policeman. They have a two-year-old child together, she said, and they all live at home.

With a little money from their monthly savings club, she was able to establish her fashion slippers business two years ago. She sells for eight hours per day at her business, from Monday to Saturday. One problem she faces is small income, because she wants to buy fashion slippers and various other goods to sell, like fashion blouses, jeans, and trousers. Her plan is to one day build a modern house and shop. She appreciates the lenders of Kiva, for supporting BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy fashion slippers and various other goods to sell, like fashion blouses, jeans, and trousers

loans.name: Tara

texts.en:
Tara is 35 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 16 and 10. Many years ago, she established her tea shop business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent loan to buy food materials for her business. In the future, Tara plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal. Called a chiya pasal, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume.

loans.use: to buy food materials for her tea shop.

loans.name: Asghar

texts.en:
Asghar is a milk seller by profession; his forefathers have been doing the same business for many years. He has gotten all the buffaloes through inheritance. He has been increasing his cattle through breeding, also. Now he has many buffaloes for getting milk. He is famous in his hometown due to the quality and freshness of the milk. 

After household usage and selling milk in his hometown, most of the milk remains unsold. After a day, the milk loses its freshness, and he does not want to lose his reputation in the market. So, he decided to sell the remaining milk in a neighboring town, but he does not have a conveyance to bring the milk.

For this purpose, Asghar decided to buy a vehicle for milk supplying with the contribution of his savings, but he does not have a sufficient amount to buy a vehicle. During the survey, the field officer met with Asghar, and took seriously his problem and approved a loan as per his desire. 

Asghar will use the vehicle for traveling with his family, also. This loan helps his family, too.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle for transporting the milk supply to the market.

loans.name: Abdulaziz

texts.en:
Abdulaziz is a 25-year-old man living in Taiz, Yemen. Abdulaziz's business is a grocery store that he started 5 years ago. He was working with his dad in construction. Then, he saved an amount to establish a grocery store. 

He knows how to attract customers through the service that he provides and the prices that he offers. His main customers are the homemakers living in his neighborhood and the local community. He is working hard to continually provide income for his family's everyday expenses. 

Being an ambitious man, he would like to expand his business. So, he took a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to buy grocery items to increase the variety of products in his store.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to increase the variety of products in his store.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is 33 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 3. In 2005, Sabita established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid three loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent one to buy grocery goods for her store.

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a 'pasal,' is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour, are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping their inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. In the future, Sabina plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods to sell at her store

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es de la Ciudad de Caacupé, esta estudiando la carrera de Radiología, y al terminar podrá ser una licenciada eficiente. Comenta que su meta es poder terminar su carrera y trabajar en su profesión para poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Quien la inspira a poder seguir sus metas es su familia, ya que quiere poder retribuirles todo lo que hicieron por ella. Ella se esfuerza y lucha por mejorar cada día.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus clases, y también para sus gastos de manutención para poder seguir con sus estudios. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Nancy is from the city of Caacupé and is studying for a career in radiology.  She would like to finish her degree in an efficient manner.  Nancy says that her goal is to complete her degree and work in a profession in which she can help other people.

Her family inspires her to continue forward with her goals, so Nancy would like to repay them for everything they have done for her.  She strives to improve each day.  Nancy is requesting this loan so that she can invest in the payment of her classes.  She will also use it for her living expenses so that she can continue her studies.  Nancy is grateful for the opportunity she has received.

loans.use: to pay for her classes and living expenses.

loans.name: Bamta

texts.fr: Madame Bamta exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de chaussures pour dames. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé. Elle veut agrandir son stock par l’achat des chaussures c'est pour cela, elle sollicite son quatrième crédit à WAGES. Elle exerce son activité au marché. Mariée, elle a 03 enfants. Bamta espère ouvrir une boutique et assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille avec le profit.
texts.en: Mrs. Bamta makes a living by selling women’s shoes. She stocks up in Lomé. She wants to expand her stock to buy shoes. This is why she is applying for her fourth loan with WAGES. She sells at the local marketplace. She is married, with three children. Bamta hopes to open a store and be able to assure the cost of food for her family thanks to her profits.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Yei

texts.en:
Yei is 38 years old, and she lives in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources and where the living conditions are much better than the capital city of Liberia. Nimba is the second most populous county in Liberia. 

Yei did not go to school, and she is married to a local businessman. They both have four children, who are between 8 months and 26 years old. Three of her children are in school, and four live at home. Her husband gave Yei money to start her business. For three years now, she has been running this business selling used shoes. She spends 10 hours on her business, from Monday to Saturday. The problem she faces is that she does not have a shop.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more used shoes for her business. Her plan is to one day build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase more used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past 20 years, Fatuma has operated a green grocery business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high competition from other green grocers. 

With the loan of 50,000 KSH that she is requesting, Fatuma wants to purchase bundles of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran is from Vanadzor town where he lives with his wife and two children. Tigran earns his living by providing cargo transportation service to locals for many years. He is a very skilled driver and does his work with great love and care. Tigran's wife works as a hairdresser and helps her husband with the family's expenses.

Unfortunately, the car through which Tigran provides the cargo transportation service is very old and needs to be entirely repaired. 

By applying for this loan Tigran wants to repair the car. As the car is the most important part of the job he is doing, the loan is very important for Tigran. He waits for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for repairing the car

loans.name: Mohan Maya

texts.en:
Mohan Maya is 45 years old.  She is married and has one child, aged 20.  Many years ago, she established her tea shop business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent to buy food to sell at her business.  In the future, Mohan Maya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal.  Called a 'chiya pasal,' these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked, while increasing their profit margin by buying in greater volume.

loans.use: to buy food to sell at her tea shop business

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo es de la ciudad de Pilar, esta estudiando la carrera de derecho, y comenta que su sueño siempre ha sido ser un excelente profesional y ejercer su profesión en la ciudad donde vivo actualmente.
Es es muy luchador y comenta que además es policía, y que de esa forma ayuda a las personas, pero que le gustaría cambien ayudarlos por medio de su carrera de derecho.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma hacer un poco mas ligera la carga que tiene, además agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en: Gustavo is from Pilar.  He is studying for a law degree and says that it has always been his dream to be an excellent professional and practice his profession in the city where he now lives.  He strives very hard and tells us that he is also a police officer and in this way, he helps people.  However, he would like to change to helping people through his law degree.  He is requesting this loan to pay for his degree fees, and in this way, lighten his load a little.  In addition, he is grateful for the opportunity he is receiving.

loans.use: to pay degree fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a compressor, to provide better service to his customers; and a polishing machine and essential equipment for his work.

loans.name: Silvia De Jesús

texts.es:
Silvia tiene 42 años de edad. Estudio hasta quinto grado, no pudo seguir los estudios porque tuvo que ayudar en las actividades agrícolas a su padre, solo eran tres hermanos: 2 mujeres y un hombre y su padre era de la idea que “del estudio no se comía”.

 Actualmente esta casada y su esposo se dedica a cultivar la tierra, poseen dos hijos de 17 y 20 años de edad, su hijo mayor acaba de terminar su bachillerato y el menor esta aún estudiando el bachillerato. 

Ella se dedica a las labores del hogar, pero le ayuda a su esposo e hijo a las actividades agrícolas, desde siempre a trabajado la agricultura, cuando estaba con su padre,  igual le tocaba ayudarle. Cultivan maíz en época lluviosa y en verano con sistema de riego. Su parcela se encuentra a 3 km de distancia, viajan en bicicleta y trabajan todos los días.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz en la época seca, aprovechando que de verano pocos cultivan maíz y hay mejores precios por la cosecha. Así, tendrá  ingresos extras cuando comercialice su producción.

Con lo que genere de sus actividades Agricolas, desea ayudar a sus hijos que puedan egresar de la universidad, ya que a ella no tuvo la oportunidad de seguir estudiando por la pobreza de su familia y otras razones.
texts.en:
Silvia is 42 years old.  She attended school until fifth grade but she could not continue her studies because she had to help her father with the farm work.  There were only three siblings, two females and one male, and her father was of the idea that “studying doesn’t put food on the table”. 
Now, she is married and her husband works to cultivate the land.  They have two children, ages 17 and 20; her older son has just finished high school and the younger is still in high school.  

Silvia devotes her time to housework, but she helps her husband and son with the farm work just as she always had to help her father when she with her him. They cultivate corn during the rainy season and in summer, they use an irrigation system. Their plot of land is 3 kilometers away so they travel by bicycle, and they work every day.

The loan she is requesting is to cultivate 7,000 square meters of corn in the dry season, taking advantage of the fact that few cultivate corn in the summer, and so the prices for the harvest are higher.  In this way, she will have additional income when she markets her production.

With what her farming activities generate, she wishes to help her children be able to graduate from university because she didn’t have the chance to continue studying due to her family’s poverty and other reasons.

loans.use: to cultivate 7,000 square meters of corn during the dry season, taking advantage of the fact that few cultivate corn in the summer.

loans.name: Kasaija

texts.en:
Kasaija is 50 years old and married with 20 children, 10 of whom attend school. He pays all their tuition. Kasaija is engaged in agriculture and it has been his major source of income since his childhood.

He has approached Ugafode for a loan of UGX 700,000 to pay tuition fees for his daughter at a nursing school. Currently, he has no money and he is looking at getting this loan as the only way to help his daughter go back to school. Kasaija hopes to pay back the loan after brewing waragi from his sugar cane and selling his coffee.

His dream is to educate the children so that they can have a bright future, but he is challenged by his limited income and the changing weather that affects his agricultural production.

loans.use: To pay tuition for his children

loans.name: Mercedes Bersabe

texts.es:
Mercedes no pudo estudiar, manifiesta que nunca conoció a  su padre y que tuvo que criarse con su abuela. Su compañero de vida es jornalero, trabaja en los cañales de la zona y también cultiva maíz para la alimentación de la familia. Sus 3 hijos están estudiando.  El mayor les ayuda en los cultivos cuando viene de estudiar, actualmente ella tiene 34 años de edad.
Desde niña a trabajado en la agricultura, cuando vivía con su abuela iba a trabajar a las algodoneras, actualmente cultiva maíz, y además tiene dos terneros que esta engordando para venderlos a final de año. Su milpa la tiene cerca de la casa. 
El dinero lo necesita para comprar un ternero, que lo engordara y venderá para tener recursos el siguiente año,  con los cuales comprara los insumos (fertilizante, plaguicidas y semilla)  en la próxima  época de cultivo
su  anhelo es sacar de sus cultivos y  del manejo de ganado, los recursos económicos que le permita a sus hijos poder terminar sus estudios de educación media y porque no pensar en que puedan ir a la universidad.
texts.en:
Mercedes couldn't study, she says that she never knew her father and that she had to grow up with her grandmother. Her life partner is a day laborer, he works in the sugar cane fields in the area and also grows corn to feed the family. Her three children are studying. The oldest helps them with the crops when he comes back from studying.

Currently, Mercedes is 34. Since childhood she has worked in agriculture, when she lived with her grandmother she went to work in the cotton fields. Currently she grows corn, and in addition she has two calves that she is fattening to sell at the end of the year. Her farm is close to the house.

She needs the money to buy a calf that she will fatten and will sell to have resources for next year. With this, she will buy supplies (fertilizer, pesticides and seeds) in the next crop cycle. Her desire is to take the income from her crops and the cattle raising so that her children might be able to complete secondary school, and why not? - maybe even go to university too.

loans.use: to buy a calf that she will fatten and sell to have resources for next year.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
Amanda vive en la ciudad de Villarrica, comenta que su meta es recibirse y montar su propio consultorio, a la par de trabajar en un Hospital o ente privado.
Comenta que sus mayores apoyos son sus padres que le ayudan a seguir luchando y estudiando a pesar de algunas dificultades que suelen aparecer. Ella está estudiando la carrera de psicología y solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus clases y para los gastos del día a día y así poder seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Amanda lives in the city of Villarrica. She says that her goal is to graduate and set up her own doctor's office, as well as work in a hospital or a private entity.She says her parents are her biggest support. They help her to continue fighting and studying in spite of some difficulties that usually appear. She is studying Psychology. 

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it for the payment of her classes and for daily expenses so she will be able to continue studying as she is doing now.

loans.use: to pay for classes and daily expenses.

loans.name: Marietta K.

texts.en: Marietta K. is 44 years old and lives in Sanniquille, the capital City of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources.  Living conditions there are much better than in the capital city of Liberia, and it is the second most populated county in Liberia. Marietta did not go to school, and she has five children between 10 and 20 years old, who are presently attending school and live at home. She is married. She started her business with money from her husband. For the past four years, she has been running a table where she sells slippers and soap. She spends eight hours at her business. The problem she faces is low income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers and soap for her business. Her plan is to build a shop in the near future. She thanks the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers and soap for her business.

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
La sra. Zulma es casada, tiene dos hijos , ella es rentista ya que tiene dos propiedades que alquila.
Actualmente ella está cursando el 3er año de la carrera de derecho, según comenta  la razón por la que volvió a estudiar es el deseo de superación personal y para poder ofrecer un mejor nivel de vida a su familia, que son los que la motivan a lograr sus objetivos.
Una vez culminado sus estudios la Señora Zulma dese abrir su propio Estudio Jurídico y trabajar en forma independiente.
Solicita de este crédito para el pago de sus cuotas de la universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando y estar cada vez más cerca de cumplir con sus metas.
texts.en:
Sra. Zulma is married and has two children. She is a landlord and has two properties that she rents out.

Currently she is in her third year of law school. She notes that the reason she returned to school was her desire for personal achievement and so that she can offer a better standard of living to her family. It is they who motivate her to achieve her objectives. Once she completes her studies Sra. Zulma wants to open her own law office and work independently.

She is requesting this loan to pay her university fees. Thus she will be able to continue studying and moving closer to meeting her goals.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Sita

texts.en:
Sita is 37 years-old, married and has two children aged 10 and 8 years old.  Many years ago, she established her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business.  In the future, Sita plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano esta estudiando la carrera de Administraron de Empresas, el se esta esforzando para poder ayudar a su familia, y quiere también poder ayudar a su comunidad.
Mariano quiere ser un profesional útil, que pueda ayudar a las personas de su comunidad. Es una persona muy luchadora y que quiere salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder pagar sus cuotas de su universidad y así seguir estudiando y estar cada vez mas cerca de cumplir con sus metas.
texts.en:
Mariano is studying Business Administration. He is working hard to be able to help his family and he also wants to help his community.

Mariano wants to be a useful professional who can help the people in his community. He is tenacious and wants to get ahead.

He is requesting this loan to be able to pay his university fees and thus continue studying and to be closer to fulfilling his goals.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Radika

texts.en:
Radika is 44 years-old. She is married and has two children who are 26 and 21 years old. Many years ago, she established her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business.  In the future, Radika plans to improve the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buys grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Edison

texts.es:
Edison esta estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Ambiental, ya que su deseo es ser un buen profesional para poder cuidar el medio ambiente.
El es un joven que quiere mejorar la vida ambiental del país que tan dejada de lado esta. Es muy visionario y con ganas de salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus clases y también las cuotas de su universidad, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo, que le abrirá muchas puertas.
texts.en:
Edison is studying to be an Environmental Engineer because he wants to become a good professional so that he can care for the environment. He is a young man who wants to improve the country’s environmental life, which has been so neglected. He is a visionary  who want to get ahead.

He is requesting this loan so that he can pay for his classes and also his university fees. The funds will be a great help. He is grateful for this opportunity, which will open many doors for him.

loans.use: to pay for his classes and fees.

loans.name: Rwobuzizi Ii Tukore Group

texts.en:
Rwobuzizi Tukore Group is located in the middle of Rwobuzizi Town. The group is comprised of mainly men and women in several categories of agriculture.

Merabu is a single mother who divorced her husband in 2009 after her husband married a second wife. She has six children of her own and takes care of her brother's two orphans who lost their father. Merabu runs a small retail shop with capital of UGX.100,000. She also does poultry farming, all of which she does single handedly. She intends to use the loan to construct an improved shelter for her poultry to protect them from harsh weather conditions, thieves and wild animals, which attack them at night. She will use the rest of the money to add stock to her retail shop and pay school fees for her children.

Her customers are neighbors and restaurant owners in town. Her main challenge is the high cost of the items in her shop, which bring only a small profit margin yet her family needs are ernomous. Despite all the challenges, Merabu is a very hard working and determined woman willing to send her children to the best schools within her area.

loans.use: To construct an improved shelter for her poultry

loans.name: Martín

texts.es:
Martín tiene 36 años,  con 3° grado de escolaridad y soltero; pero dependen cuatro personas tres hermanas y la mamá y solo él trabaja para el sustento diario. El trabajo es en la agricultura, trabajo que aprendió, porqué se obligo desde pequeño cuando su papá falleció que él tenia 10 años y la familia quedo a su responsabilidad.

Siempre se ha dedicado a la siembra de maíz, no existe la posibilidad de dedicarse a otra actividad. Por el compromiso tiene y pocos recursos, el trabajo lo realiza en la comunidad, para llegar debe caminar unos 20 minutos por momentos le apoyan sus hermanas en trabajos no muy pesados como es en la fertilización a su trabajo le dedica más o menos cuatro horas diarias.

Con el préstamo solicitado a fundación CAMPO, comprara cinco sacos de abono de dos quintales cada uno para fertilizar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz.
Su sueño, es adquirir una parcela de tierra propia para trabajar; ya que por el momento es alquilada, quiere realizar un buen récord crediticio, para que más adelante le financien un poco más,  sus ingresos en la actualidad son solo para gastos de la familia. Pero considera, que  en el futuro obtener una mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Martin is 36 years old, single, and has a 3rd grade education. But 4 people (3 brothers and his mother) depend on him. He alone works daily to sustain them. Martin works in agriculture; he does what he learned, as he has been obliged since he was small -- his father died when Martin was 10 years old and the family became his responsibility.

Martin has always grown corn; there is no possibility of dedicating himself to another activity. For his commitment he has few resources. He works in the community. To get there, he has to walk 20 minutes. At times, his brothers are able to help him with light labor, such as fertilizing. He dedicates more or less 4 hours per day to his work.

With the loan he is soliciting through the Campo Foundation, he will buy 5 sacks (of 2 quintals each) of manure to fertilize 7,000 square meters of corn.

Martin's dream is to acquire his own parcel of land to work. At the moment, he rents crop land. Martin also wants to establish a good credit record, so that in the future he can obtain a little more financing. His income, at present, goes entirely for family expenses. But he hopes to obtain a better income in the future.

loans.use: buy 5 sacks of manure (of 2 quintals each) to fertilize 7,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Neegba Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of very committed women and men, who have been developing [their businesses] since the creation of the group 'Neegba' in 6 June 2011. In addition to the income generating activities centered around small-scale commerce, they meet to support one another in social need, for example a funeral. 

James (standing second from left) is the featured borrower of this group. He is a physically challenged goldsmith who manufactures gold enamel (necklace, wrist band, earrings, trophy, etc.). He is married and a father of four children, one boy and three girls.  James and his group are requesting the second loan from Kiva and fourth loan cycle from ID-Ghana. His business is well-known in the area. He make these gold enamels and supplies to customers from the capital city of Ghana.  He needs GHS 600 to procure raw gold from Obuasi so that he can use it for creating different designs of necklaces, wrist bands, earrings, etc. to supply to customers.  In addition to increasing his savings in order to qualify for a larger loan, he also hopes to support his children in their schooling and expansion of work.

The group needs a total amount of GHS 9150 to be able to buy more eggs, provisions, second hand clothing, bags, vegetables, cooking oil etc.

loans.use: To procure raw gold from Obuasi so that he can use it for creating different designs of necklace, wrist band, earrings, etc. to supply to customers.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha is 47 years old and lives in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County which is rich in natural resources. The living conditions are much better in the capital city, and it is the second most populated county in Liberia. 

Oretha did not go to school, because she has lived all her life in a rural area of Sanniquelle. Traditionally, Oretha is married to a farmer. They both have five children, aged between 18 and 20. All her children are in school since they now live in the City of Sanniquelle. Oretha says she received a little money from her husband who works with an N.G.O to establish her business. She spends 10 hours on her business. One problem she faces is small income. She is requesting this loan to purchase more rice, pepper, vita, oil, etc for this business. Her plan is to one day own a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, vita, oil, etc for this business.

loans.name: Mabungo Tukorere Hamwe Group

texts.en:
Born in 1960, Patrick lives with his family (wife and four children) in Mabungo – Masya, located a few kilometers from Rukungiri Town District – Western Uganda. He is a sugar cane farmer as well as a vegetable gardener.
Appointed to be the secretary of Mabungo Tukorere Hamwe Group, Patrick  has requested a loan on behalf of the group. It is the third loan that he is getting from UGAFODE Micro finance Limited (MDI). This loan is for  buying chairs and tents for renting out . 
As a group this loan will help to increase each one's income since they will share the proceeds from the rental business.

loans.use: To buy chairs and tents to rent out

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, con lo que quiere poder ayudar a las personas por medio de su trabajo.
Su meta es ser una buena profesional en el ámbito de la Salud y así poder servir a la sociedad de la mejor manera posible. Lo que más la inspira es el apoyo que le da toda su familia, ya que ellos son su principal pilar.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder utilizarlo en sus cuotas de la universidad, como así también en los gastos de manutención. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Rosa is from the city of Paraguari, she is studying to become a nurse, to be able to help people through her work.  
Her goal is to be a good professional in the health industry and this way serve society in the best way possible.  What inspires her the most is the support she gets from all of her family, they are her rock.  
She requests this loan to pay university tuition, as well as maintenance fees.  She is thankful for the opportunity she is getting, as it will be of much help.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition, as well as maintenance fees to become a nurse.

loans.name: Princess

texts.en:
Princess is 23 years old and lives in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County. This county is rich in natural resources, and living conditions here are much better than in the capital city of Liberia. Nimba is the second most-populated county in Liberia.

Princess stopped her education at grade ninth. She and her boyfriend live together. They have two children together, aged 1 and 5. She said that only one of the children is in school.

By selling for her mother, she was able to establish her business. Since 2009 she has been running her own table business at a local market, where she sells food products, like rice, pepper, and oil. She spends 9 hours per day on her business. One problem she faces in business is small income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more food products to sell at her market table, including rice, pepper, and oil. Her plans are to own a modern house one day, and to educate her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more food products to sell at her market table, including rice, pepper, and oil.

loans.name: Ludys De Jesús

texts.es: Ludys, con 47 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su compañero sentimental; nació y creció en el campo donde aprendió las labores del campo y, gracias a ello, hoy en día se dedica a elaborar y comercializar quesos por todo el sector del municipio donde reside; de esta manera obtiene los recursos necesarios para aportar a la economía del hogar. Su labor comienza desde la madrugada, cuando se levanta a sacar la producción para luego salir a venderla. La cliente es una mujer luchadora, entusiasta y humilde, siempre va en busca de opciones que le permitan seguir progresando. Actualmente solicita el crédito, con el cual desea comprar insumos al por mayor (leche y bolsas para empaque) y adquirir un medio de transporte (bicicleta), de esta manera podrá tener disponibilidad de productos para aumentar su producción y podrá satisfacer la demanda actual que posee, además podrá entregar los pedidos de manera más ágil y oportuna, lo que se verá reflejado en el incremento de sus ventas y sus ingresos. Es así como Ludys desea seguir avanzando para poder cumplir el sueño de hacer crecer su negocio y convertirlo en una distribuidora de lácteos, que sea rentable y reconocida en el sector, esto le permitirá adquirir más recursos económicos con los que podrá mejorar sus condiciones de vida para disfrutar al lado de su familia.
texts.en: Ludys, 47 years old, lives in a common-law marriage with her romantic partner. She was born and raised in the country, where she learned country work, and thanks to that, today she makes and sells cheeses throughout the area of the city where she lives. In this way she obtains the resources necessary to contribute to the household economy. Her work starts early in the morning, when she rises to take out the product and then go out and sell it. She is a fighter, enthusiastic and humble. She is always looking for options that will allow her to continue making progress. Currently she is asking for the loan, with which she wants to buy wholesale supplies (milk and bags for packaging) and acquire a means of transportation (bicycle). In this way she will have products available to increase her production and she will be able to satisfy her current demand. She will also be able to deliver the orders in a more agile and timely way, which will be reflected in the increase of her sales and her income. This is how Ludys wants to continue advancing in order to be able to achieve the dream of making her business grow and turning it into a milk products distributor that is profitable and well-known in the area. This will allow her to acquire more economic resources with which she will be able to improve her living conditions and enjoy it alongside her family.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies (milk and bags for packaging) and acquire a means of transportation (bicycle)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy retail stock items to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman who has six children, two of whom attend school. The rest of her children are adults. She lives in a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over twenty-six years, she has operated a food-selling business, preparing various foods such as rice, flat bread, beans, and tea. She sells from her home, to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

With the KES 40,000 loan funds, she wants to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, rice, and beans for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for foods she will prepare and sell, including wheat flour, cooking oil, rice, and beans

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 48 years old. He trades in produce. He has requested a loan of UGX 1,000,000. He will use the loan to acquire a piece of land comprising a coffee plantation. This will enable him to begin harvesting some coffee from his own land, instead of buying everything from the neighbours. This will help him save some money with which to educate his children. He is hard-working, and he thanks Kiva for taking interest in his ventures.

loans.use: to buy a small coffee plantation

loans.name: Saúl Antonio

texts.es: Saúl, a sus 66 años de edad, es padre de 3 hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Toda su vida la ha pasado en el campo, lugar donde nació y aprendió las labores agrícolas, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. Hoy en día posee cultivos de yuca, plátano y ñame, cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y vendidas en la plaza de mercado del municipio donde reside, esta actividad se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, por lo cual trabaja incansablemente durante toda la semana desde las 4:00 am. Actualmente posee el apoyo del crédito, que invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes) con el fin de darle continuidad a su negocio y poder cosechar productos de muy buena calidad, para poder venderlos a un mejor precio y así aumentar su margen de utilidades; todo esto le permitirá sobrepasar diferentes obstáculos ocasionados por situaciones externas que no puede controlar, que afectan directamente sus cultivos como son las inundaciones que se presentan por la temporada de lluvias y los costos elevados de los insumos que no permiten realizar el mantenimiento constante de los cultivos, afectando su estabilidad económica. Saúl es un señor pujante y perseverante, lo que lo impulsa a seguir luchando y poder continuar con esta actividad, pues anhela tener la capacidad económica para ofrecerle a su familia un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida, para disfrutar durante los años que le quedan de vida.
texts.en: Saúl is 66 years old.  He is the father of three children and lives in a common-law marriage with his partner.  He has lived all of his life in the country, the place where he was born and learned farming, thanks to his parents’ teachings.  Today, he has yucca, banana, and yam crops that he gathers and sells at the market plaza in the town where he lives.  This activity has become his main source of income and he works tirelessly throughout the week starting at 4:00 a.m.  Now, he has the support of this loan, which he will invest in the purchase of farming inputs (manure, pesticides, fertilizer) with the goal of providing continuity to his business and thus, increasing his profit margin. All this will allow him to overcome various obstacles caused by external situations he cannot control that directly affect his crops such as floods that occur in the rainy season and high input costs that do not allow the constant maintenance of crops, affecting economic stability. Saúl is a strong and persevering gentleman who is driven to keep striving and be able to continue with this labor because he longs to have the capacity to offer his family a better well-being and quality of life, and to enjoy the remaining years of his life.

loans.use: to purchase farming inputs (manure, pesticides, fertilizers).

loans.name: Louise

texts.fr: Célibataire de 25ans, Louise exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus des produits cosmétiques, des mèches dans une boutique louée à cet effet. Démarrée en 2007 et n'arrivant plus à satisfaire les besoins des clients à cause du manque de marchandises, elle fait sa deuxième demande de crédit à WAGES. Le profit lui permettra d'ouvrir d'autres points de vente et de fonder plus tard une famille financièrement stable.
texts.en: Louise is 25 years old and single. She makes a living by selling cosmetic products and hair extension out of a store she rents for this purpose. She launched her business in 2007. She is having difficulties meeting her customers’ needs due to stock ruptures, which is why she is applying for her second loan  with WAGES. The revenues will allow her to open additional sales point and, later on, be able to start a financially stable family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Erisbey

texts.es: Erisbey es una mujer de 35 años de edad, soltera y no tiene hijos. Actualmente está desempleada y no le ha sido fácil conseguir nuevas oportunidades de empleo, por esta razón y, con el ideal de generar ingresos por cuenta propia, desea iniciar su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes y legumbrería, para lo cual ya tiene local que se encuentra ubicado en un barrio popular de la ciudad donde reside; el negocio lo ha ido organizando con unos ahorros que poseía, pero actualmente se anima a solicitar el crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de activos fijos (estanterías y vitrinas) y surtido al por mayor (verduras, granos, pastas, productos de aseo y otros productos de la canasta familiar), esto le dará la posibilidad de iniciar con su idea de negocio, con el cual espera atraer muchos clientes para que conozcan la calidad de sus productos y del servicio que ofrece, pues este último será el factor diferenciador que le hará aumentar poco a poco su clientela y por ende, sus ventas. Erisbey es activa, emprendedora y pujante, día a día está en busca de nuevas posibilidades que le abran las puertas para llegar a progresar y mejorar las condiciones de vida y, así avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño que es tener un minimercado, reconocido, rentable y sostenible en el tiempo, con el que espera generar nuevas oportunidades de empleo a madres cabeza de hogar.
texts.en: Erisbey is 35 years old, single and has no children.  She is currently unemployed and it hasn't been easy to find new employment opportunities, this is why with the goal to generate her own income, has decided to start her own business, a convenience store where she will also sell legumes, she already has the location for it in a popular neighborhood of the city where she lives; the business was set up with savings she had, but she now wanting to request a loan, to invest it in buying fixed assets (displays and shelves) and to stock at wholesale prices (vegetables, grains, pasta, cleaning products and other basic needs products), this will give her the possibility to start with the business idea, with which she hopes to attract many customers, who will see the quality of her products and the service she provides, hoping the latter will differentiate her and help her build a client base and as a result, sales.  Erisbey is active, entrepreneurial and works hard, day to day she is looking for new possibilities to open doors that will help her progress and improve her quality of life, and this way move towards achieving her mail goal which is to have a mini-market that is well-known, profitable and sustainable over time, with which she hopes to generate jobs to mothers that are heads of their household.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets (displays and shelves) and to stock at wholesale prices (vegetables, grains, pasta, cleaning products and other basic needs products)

loans.name: Dúo Oasis De Amor Group

texts.es: Dúo Oasis de amor, Sara Hernández  de 28 años de edad, quien es originaria de la localidad de San Juan Sacatepéquez,  tiene como actividad económica una venta de consumo diario el cual ella ubica en su domicilio, logrando ofrecer productos básicos, como arroz, frijol, azúcar , venta de pan, jugos, verduras, es por esa razon que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos de consumo diario, esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: The “Oasis de Amor” duo includes 28 year old Sara Hernandez, originally from San Juan Sacatepéquez, and who sells daily consumables out of her home.  She sells basic products such as rice, beans, sugar, bread, juices, and vegetables, so she is asking for a loan to buy more products.  She hopes that you will be able to help her with this loan.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Ablam

texts.fr: Chauffeur de profession Ablam pour joindre les deux bouts revend aussi des charbons de bois à domicile.  Pour satisfaire les besoins des clients, il sollicite son second crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises. Elle espère louer un magasin pour stocker plus de marchandises et assurer une meilleure scolarité des enfants. Il a pour femme une revendeuse et 03 enfants de 08ans,03ans et 06 mois.  Ablam quand à lui est âgé de 42ans avec une ancienneté de 21ans.
texts.en: Ablam is a driver by trade. He makes ends meet by also selling charcoal out of his home. In order to meet customer demand, he is applying for his second loan with WAGES to restock. He hopes to rent a warehouse to stock a bigger volume of charcoal and be able to provide for a better education for his children. His wife is a vendor. They have three children: eight years, three years and six months of age. Ablam is 42 years old and has 21 years of work experience.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.
